column9: Fwiw it was a money-saving-expert so-called "" code stacking trick"" where new customers could get the booze at a ridiculously low price by invoking the 25%off six bottles plus a new customer discount on a sixty quid spend on an already reduced item. Its now obviously been rumbled by Sainsbury, and, as is their right they're refusing to honour any of the orders unless already despatched...something that is written in black and white in their terms and conditions. What we're seeing here is the aftermath of miffed one time first time chancers who missed out. Bless 'em.

column4: I was expecting my very first order tomorrow. Having tried to update my order today I was told that I couldn t do this as I had bottles of Prosecco in my basket. I now have received an email this evening telling me that due to demand that the Prosecco deal has been removed but I could have an e- voucher  instead ?????? Really Sainsburys? Order with you cancelled and will not bother shopping with you again.
column9: Lets be honest...you probably wouldn't shop with them again anyway now this code stacking new customer trick hasn't worked...

column9: I'll make this my last one (unless anyone chooses to respond), but it's to say that I'm more confused than ever now. I've just seen an advert for another corporate monstrosity (Ikea to be precise, link below) who have told me that ""maybe the little things are really the big things"". I don't know what to believe anymore. It's as if everything that I thought I knew and understood has crumbled in front of me and vanished.  A bit like the blessed prosecco.  Pat, I would never compare horrific world events with my concerns over obtaining cheap prosecco. I don't think that I've said anything that would suggest that I equate these things, but I have yet to meet anyone who hasn't at some point got upset or disappointed with the smaller things.  Also, I'm banging on about the principle, rather than the prosecco.  I'd have quite liked the prosecco, mind you. At the price I thought I was getting it at, I wouldn't have cared if it wasn't very nice.

column4: I like Sainsbury s. Generally. But really sometimes happens something totally weird. This is the current situation in the Farnborough (Hampshire) unit since a couple of days: Highland spring water  50p for a bottle of 1.5l. Great price! Reduced from 60p. So you get the pack of 6 and you pay... 3.20£. Now this is in contrast with the laws of the market (if you buy a bunch of the same item the price of the singe unit diminishes). Obviously it is also in contrast with the math: 6 time 0.50p = 3.00£. So... if you buy more  you spend... more then what you expect.  Isn t it weird?
column9: The bar code is 5010459005025.

column9: Hi Giuseppe, thanks for getting in touch. Although in a lot of circumstances you'll save more by buying a larger pack size, we do occasionally run promotions on certain items in order to help them sell. This can mean the larger pack size remains the same price while single units become cheaper due to the special offer. Can you send me a barcode for the item? I'll find out if there's a certain promotion running. Ryan.

column4: I ordered this last week and had it been delivered last week I would have got the deal. Due to work commitments I couldn t have it delivered until tomorrow - an hour ago I received this. Disgusting 😡  We wanted to let you know that unfortunately due to unprecedented demand the Taste The Difference Prosecco you ordered is no longer available on the promotion price of £7.50. This means you will be charged the full price of £10 minus any discount that might apply  for example buy 6 bottles of wine and save 25%.  So that you don t lose out we would still like to honour the offer  we have therefore added the price difference as an e-voucher to your account which you can use next time you shop online.  You ll find full terms and conditions for all of our offers on our website  click here http://help.sainsburys.co.uk/help/website/terms-conditions-online-payment  Thanks for shopping with Sainsbury s  Kind regards  Customer Service Team

column4: I recently had a very disappointing online shopping experience with your Bognor Regis branch - I missed my delivery slot (it was due between 16.30 - 17.30 and he arrived at 16.36  whereas I was stuck in traffic coming from London and didn t get to the house until 17.00). I take full responsibility for that but given that the order was for a very large shop  the person I spoke to in the customer service department wasn t at all interested in trying to help me out or find any kind of solution. That then left me with 13 people arriving for a weekend for a special family celebration and no food so I had to rush out myself to go and buy enough for that evening. It was arranged that the shop would then come on Saturday morning first thing but it was only the alcohol and the cupboard produce that arrived - there was no fresh produce. The alcohol also had all their security tags on them which meant we were unable to open any of them. Again  no help from your customer service team who told me they couldn t deliver it until 2pm - so yet again  I had to rush out to the supermarket to go and buy enough for breakfast for everyone. I tried to get hold of your online manager there on a number of occasions and it wasn t until my third message that she called me back. I was expecting to hear back from her with some sort of solution or compensation for all the extra food I had to buy but have heard nothing from her. I shop with you every week and have always had a very good experience but this really is completely unacceptable and so disappointing. During such a competitive time when I would have thought that supermarkets would be trying to keep their loyal and regular customers  this is definitely not what I would have expected.
column9: Sorry you had such a hassle Coralie. Could you PM your order number and the name, postcode and email address on the account? Leigh

column4: This is a complaint regarding my Fridge Freezer we purchased with Argos in October 2014. We had only had it a couple of weeks and it start making funny noises which we later learnt it was the compressor not working correctly  few months later it completely broke down and we were with out a Fridge freezer for 6 weeks Argos refused to replace it  sent a engineer from Indesit He showed my Husband how to deal with the noise problem which is a joke as my husband is not a well man. It has broke again and have now wait 4 weeks for an engineer one due out on the 7th never turned up on the 24th no phone call ! Argos will not replace with out an independent assessment  which is madness as we have to pay for it we paid £500 on the 31st of October 2014 a new fridge freezer should last at least 5 years not just 8 months as its now 18months later we sit here withno food in a fridge due to the fact we can only buy on a daily basis as to put in fridge it all goes off .Cheese ham and cook beef from saturday had to be throw away this morning. All we want is a replacement so we can shop and cook meals We will never shop from Argos again..
column9: Exactly, to get them to do anything, it is the consumer who has to pay for the report, they don't do anything without it.....

Argos will not replace with out an independent assessment  which is madness as we have to pay for it we paid £500 on the 31st of October 2014 a new fridge freezer should last at least 5 years not just 8 months as its now 18months later we sit here withno food in a fridge due to the fact we can only buy on a daily basis as to put in fridge it all goes off .Cheese ham and cook beef from saturday had to be throw away this morning. All we want is a replacement so we can shop and cook meals We will never shop from Argos again..
column9: It's the law.

column9: I was trying to use my nectar card to pay for something but as I hadn't used it in that store before she refused and basically made me feel like I had stolen the card! I then walked away without buying anything absolutely disgusted and went to customer services, however on my way I did pick up the clearly marked price tag and showed them! At this point we asked to see a manager and a very 'scruffy' supervisor came to speak to us! He was called Kev! He then said he apologised about the melon but didn't know what he could do with his staff and would mention it, the man who had done all of this by this point was standing around me, my mum and my 15 month old child in a very nasty way and making us feel like criminals with 2 other colleagues!! column4: How long has Sainsburys on the Purley Way known today is a bank holiday Monday? Went into the cafè at 3pm to be told sold out of jacket potatoes  soup  sandwiches  all cakes and they can t do toast as the toaster has been switched off (although they can toast a tea cake which a customer after me got??!) oh and they also ran out of milk for my cup of tea??! Unbelievable! The cafe is open until 7pm! Are Sainsburys unaware they may need to stock up on a bank holiday? Cannot they get reserves from the store (to which I was told  we aren t allowed to do that ) This is the second time I ve been to a Sainsburys cafe and the second time had terrible service. Really disappointed in you Sainsburys!

column4: I don t much like your cover  photo  which is not exactly welcoming to someone like me - ethical vegan- but I m here at the moment to say I like the design on your Bag for Life. Unlike the one Waitrose is currently offering  it is one I can carry with integrity. I AM nuts about recycling. But I am also nuts about veganism  for the animals  the planet and my own health. Waitrose has a bag design which is offensive to vegans. I can t possibly use it as it is - but I have scrawled all over it to make it possible for me to not be disgusted to carry it about with me. Yours  on the other hand  is great.  I hope you will continue to print designs on your bags that your vegan and vegetarian customers will be happy to take out with them.
column9: Glad you like the bags Carol, and I hope you continue to enjoy shopping with us! Have a lovely evening. Susanna

column4: I would like to make a complaint about the customer service I received in your Salisbury store on Friday evening. I am nearly 5 months pregnant and was absolutely desperate for a wee. The public toilets out in the carpark were closed  so I entered the store (where I was about to do my weekly shop) and saw 3 female staff members chatting near the tills. I went and explained my situation and was told I couldn t use a toilet! Then they told me the nearest one is about 5 minutes walk away  to which I explained I wasn t able to hold it any longer. I left the store in tears and had to return to my car. My husband drove me to waitrose  where I was able to use a toilet  we then did our shop there instead. I am absolutely disgusted that your staff were unable to help me  a pregnant woman in a desperate situation!
column9: Really sorry about this Rachel! This isn't the service we expect our customers to receive. Which store were you visiting? Did you get a name/ description of the colleagues in question? If so can you PM us it? I'd like to have this passed to management. Faiza

column9: Here is my PM reply from Sainsburys.....  Thanks for your patience Rachel. I've spoken to the Store Manager, Gary. He has advised that, as the store has no public loos, we don't have the ability to allow customers to use the facilities. This is for safety reasons as the colleague toilets are located in areas that are off limits to customers. He's sorry for the experience you've had and advises that the council run the toilets in the car park, which unfortunately means we don't have any control over their opening times. Apologies again for the experience you had. Susanna

column4: Please excuse this   wall of text   but I d just like to offer some constructive feedback on your delivery service in the Wyre Forest area. After about a year at £1  my usual Thursday delivery slot shot up to £3 overnight. I grumbled  but I m paying it because the drivers continue to arrive within my chosen hour  unfailingly cheerful  polite and helpful  and it s still a reasonable price.   I wish I could say the same for the people who pack the boxes for delivery. Standards are definitely on the decline. Last Thursday I discovered that my milk containers had been placed on their sides in the bottom of a box  and then so much had been thrown  on top  that one of the bottles had leaked milk all over the bottom of the box. Had I not needed the contents of that box I would have sent the whole thing back  but as it was  the driver kindly refunded me the items that had to have packaging completely removed  and also for the rather dented  leaky bottle of milk.   The driver was brilliant; he got some paper towel to help me dry all the items in the box so I could take them to my kitchen. They all had to be washed before I could put them away to avoid the stink of dried milk.  After the driver had gone  I found more items whose packaging had to be disposed of as it had become saturated with milk. I was too fed up to bother chasing refunds etc. and that s really not what I m after anyway. These packing errors make the drivers  jobs more difficult than they already are  and that s just not fair on them.  This isn t the first time I ve had to be refunded for damaged goods  or for rotten fruit/veg. The standard used to be great  but since more people are opting for online services  the standards in the warehouses seems to be slipping somewhat. The delivery drivers - in my area at least - remain some of the best ambassadors for Sainsbury s and you should be proud of them. I wish I could say the same for the pickers/packers; it s as if they simply don t care.
column9: I'm not after freebies or vouchers, so I shan't bother to PM, since that's probably what you'll do. The price for the Thursday 10-11am slot did indeed increase from from £1 to £3 about 2 weeks ago, and has stayed the same since. it was described as a 'fluctuation', but forgive my scepticism on that!  I just wanted to offer some feedback on areas I think the service needs improvement, and areas I think it's great, in the hope you could take something from it.  If the staff who pick and pack the boxes are slipping up maybe there's a problem in the team? If staff are doing a crap job, it's usually because they see no reason to take pride in their work. From professional experience I know that's usually a management issue. One of the greatest motivators to work is being made to feel appreciated. Maybe they aren't feeling it? They don't get the first hand experience with customers that the drivers do, so they'll never get the thanks, and the praise unless their managers offer it. As a manager I learned to deal with good performance in exactly the same way as I dealt with poor performance. I made sure eac individual was made aware of something they'd done well, and what was good about it. it actually goes further than a tiny pay rise, and costs nothing!

No company is perfect, and I've found that I can learn a lot about how a business is run by how they deal with problems, mistakes and complaints. And also from the condition of their toilets - seriously!   Thanks again, feedback is the breakfast of champions, eh?

column4: Please excuse this   wall of text   but I d just like to offer some constructive feedback on your delivery service in the Wyre Forest area. After about a year at £1  my usual Thursday delivery slot shot up to £3 overnight. I grumbled  but I m paying it because the drivers continue to arrive within my chosen hour  unfailingly cheerful  polite and helpful  and it s still a reasonable price.   I wish I could say the same for the people who pack the boxes for delivery. Standards are definitely on the decline. Last Thursday I discovered that my milk containers had been placed on their sides in the bottom of a box  and then so much had been thrown  on top  that one of the bottles had leaked milk all over the bottom of the box. Had I not needed the contents of that box I would have sent the whole thing back  but as it was  the driver kindly refunded me the items that had to have packaging completely removed  and also for the rather dented  leaky bottle of milk.   The driver was brilliant; he got some paper towel to help me dry all the items in the box so I could take them to my kitchen. They all had to be washed before I could put them away to avoid the stink of dried milk.  After the driver had gone  I found more items whose packaging had to be disposed of as it had become saturated with milk. I was too fed up to bother chasing refunds etc. and that s really not what I m after anyway. These packing errors make the drivers  jobs more difficult than they already are  and that s just not fair on them.  This isn t the first time I ve had to be refunded for damaged goods  or for rotten fruit/veg. The standard used to be great  but since more people are opting for online services  the standards in the warehouses seems to be slipping somewhat. The delivery drivers - in my area at least - remain some of the best ambassadors for Sainsbury s and you should be proud of them. I wish I could say the same for the pickers/packers; it s as if they simply don t care.
column9: Hi Helen, thanks for taking the time to get in touch. I'm really sorry that this delivery hasn't been up to scratch compared to our usual high standards you're used to. I've checked into this and it seems the delivery slots haven't changed price, however they do vary depending on demand and availability so it may have been that your slot has been busier than usual for this delivery, resulting in a higher cost. Can you send me your order number and the account holders name in a PM please? I'll see what we can do to help! Ryan.

column4: I have just been and filled my car at castle marina Nottingham  my 9 yr old son got out the car as was going to choose sweets when I paid  the pump had been activated and while I was filling up I saw the young cashier say something to the old cashier who then got on his tannoy and said pump 7 no children on the forecourt  get back in the car! No please no thank you and no explanation when I went to pay as they were far to busy looking on the security woman s phone! My son was so upset and embarrassed by this action and cried saying what have I done wrong! I worked in a filling station for many years  I know under 16 s can t dispense or pay for fuel but where does it state they can t stand by a car??? The cashier in question obviously needs to brush up on his customer service skills  I shall no longer use sainsburys!
column9: Livid!!! Jumped up t**t

column4: Hi  I was at your Eastbourne Hampden Park store yesterday with my two week old baby. She was hungry and I needed to feed her (I am breastfeeding) so went into the baby change room to do this expecting there to be somewhere to sit so I could feed my baby. I was disappointed to see that there was nowhere to sit to feed  the room was incredibly small and I only just had space to take my pram in the room with me and in the end had to feed my baby standing up. I just wanted to express my disappointment and share my experience which wasn t good as a breastfeeding mother and will be a factor in deciding if I visit this store again in the near future. Thank you.
column9: Sorry about that. We provide these changing rooms to help our customers and I'm sorry they we've disappointed you. I've logged your comments onto our system to reviewed in the future. Thanks for bringing this to our attention. Megan.

Beware of the quality of TVs which appear to good value.  I purchased a Celsus TV in Sept 2014  which has now given up the ghost in less than 2 years.  I m told I have to get an engineers report  at my own cost  and IF the fault is known to the manufacturer then I MAY get some compensation.  I guess if it s not a known fault  it s just proverbial tough s**t then.....meanwhile I have no TV of course......not exactly the good service I would have expected.
column9: A TV should last longer than this, regardless.  I'm a little disappointed :(

column4: Sainsbury’s has been ranked in the top 3 of Greenpeace’s league tables for the past 5 years. I am writing now to ask that Sainsbury’s take responsibility for the sustainability of all tuna tins on your shelves - not just your own brand.  Why is Sainsbury’s selling John West tuna?  You know that John West have broken their commitment to clean up their supply chain. Despite this  you continue to stock their unsustainable tuna  caught using large nets associated with Fish Aggregating Devices  a method that causes indiscriminate harm to marine life  and notably to endangered species such as sharks and turtles.  Sainsbury’s has been helping lead the way toward a sustainable tuna market in the UK. But in the last 2 weeks  Tesco and Waitrose said they could drop John West if they don’t reach high sustainability standards and renounce this destructive fishing method. I would expect nothing less from Sainsbury’s.  I sincerely hope you will take action to ensure Sainsbury’s is selling 100% sustainable tuna.
column9: Customers should stop buying JW tuna and retailers will naturally stop stocking it.

column4: Sainsbury’s has been ranked in the top 3 of Greenpeace’s league tables for the past 5 years. column4: I am currently sat in your Cheltenham store  I ve had a bit of a morning! I attempted to take my 4 month old son to a baby group this morning after rushing around all morning to get there we walked 45 minutes to get there To be told it wasn t on! I started to walk back home and happened to be walking past your store when my son became hungry! I entered your cafe and sat in the corner and began breastfeeding my son. A lovely lady called Zoe who was working in the cafe approached me as she could obviously see I was a bit hot and flustered and offered me a glass of water. We exchanged small talk and she brought me back a big glass of ice water! What a lovely lady. I just wanted to share my story with you as I was really impressed that you have people working for you that are so kind and considerate!! She made me smile 😊
column9: It was the one on Tewksbury road Cheltenham 😊

I started to walk back home and happened to be walking past your store when my son became hungry! I entered your cafe and sat in the corner and began breastfeeding my son. A lovely lady called Zoe who was working in the cafe approached me as she could obviously see I was a bit hot and flustered and offered me a glass of water. We exchanged small talk and she brought me back a big glass of ice water! What a lovely lady. I just wanted to share my story with you as I was really impressed that you have people working for you that are so kind and considerate!! She made me smile 😊
column9: Can you please tell her she made my afternoon ☺️ x

column4: Hello can you please tell me your policy on delivering food in an online shop that only has had a shelf life of one or two days? Again today i had to throw away some mince because it went off the day after my delivery. Happens so many times and its a total waste of food and money and inconvenient. Thank you
column9: Hey there Liza, sorry about that. In order to reduce food wastage, we sell goods up to their use by date. Can you PM over your order number please? Chris.

column4: This morning I visited your Milton KEYNES store to buy some cigarettes  (I know I shouldn t smoke) not only was there one person serving with a huge line of customers waiting to be served but the attitude of your employee stinks.  Her name is Oonagh and she has one of the worse customer service attitudes I have ever come across.  On asking her for my brand she states she has none  I politely ask her  which has she got that are similar  her reply was  you have to tell me  I looked at her with surprise and said  well could you open up the door so I could look  she said couldn t do that!!!  What the hell is going on with this woman as this isn t the first time I ve come across her disgusting attitude?  How is a customer supposed to know what you have for sale if they cannot see  especially when you don t have the item they want?
column9: Hey there, Mark! So sorry for the upset, the reason my colleague had to do this is down to government legislation. You can read all about it here: http://tinyurl.com/zvunk9w. Chris.

hello  i went into the store at southend  london road today to buy cigarettes  and was told i need id and of course i dont carry around id with me at the age of 35  the lady wouldnt have it so i walked away very annoyed as basically saying im a child  she saw my husband there so she must be saying his a peado  she served me a few times before so if she thinks im underage then she broke the law last week right ? i then walked of to get shopping and got followed my security and they tried telling me i was thretening her and follwed me to the car  i never and would never as im disabled and because im disabled i had one of my panic attacks outside the store then fainted and thats the way your staff treat customers so i will never be shopping there again  i am fuming
column9: Well I am disappointed with you sainburys in fact I am disgusted with your poor insult of an apology, my daughter has just explained to you the rudeness of your staff towards her by the counter staff and the circuitry staff, the embarrassment she went through having been followed to her car by him then clasping due to her illness and all you can do is say sorry for your experience well well done you jobs worth

column4: I have just eaten THE BEST piece of cake  since I was  a child 40 years ago!!...Lemon drizzle sponge with lemon curd and fresh cream bought from Sainsbury s in Beeston  Nottingham.  The sponge had a beautiful  soft  course open texture texture- exactly like  a perfect home made cake. Filled with a beautiful balance of tangy  zesty lemon  complimenting the gentle  smooth  rich texture of fresh cream. FINUALLY a cake that doesn t disappoint.... but much  much more  a  DEVINE cake that delivers on every level. The one down side??... cannot find it online....terrified that it is a  one off  and can never taste again....Sainsbury s please reassure????  Feel duty bound to inform true cake lovers of this perfect addition but also wary...I will have to send out a  posse  if I cannot buy again  due to over demand.
column9: Hi Julie, glad you enjoyed it! Do you happen to still have any packaging for the product that you can send the barcode from please? Stephen.

column9: Hi Hazel, we sell goods up until midnight on the day of their expiry as part of our commitments to reduce food waste across the UK. column9: Sorry the dates aren't suitable Hazel. Can you PM your order number and the name, postcode and email address on the account? Leigh

column4: I would just like to say how disgusted I am with the grocery delivery I have received today- out of date goods which are best before today (26 May) and tomorrow (27 May) only cupboard and frozen goods has a date longer than May 2016  and I paid over £60 😞😡😡
column9: I disagree and I am not arguing with you any more your website states if I'm unhappy with the dates I get a full refund items were short life o had bagged delivery none in blue bags n not highlighted on delivery note I will just take my complaint higher and via other avenues. I have looked at the website and everywhere it states quality produce hand picked if unhappy Full refund nothing pointed out and yes some items are included under this policy so you are so wrong not refunding me. You should follow the website promises and as I didn't know I have to detain my driver every time to unpack I couldn't return the items . I returned the wash powder that was highlighted and would have also returned these items!!!!!!! Very unhappy with Sainsburys quality and your customer service

column4: After shopping in your Newport  IOW store I have to say I am disgusted with your level of customer service. Last week we received a voucher for £10 off a £50 online shop. It hadn t printed correctly and so I couldn t see the code. Annoying but tonight this happened again. When we asked for help from the female supervising the self serve she said  no-one even uses them anyway  !! We were given a number to phone and after trying to explain the problem she told us she had to phone the store and that she would phone us back. 2 hours later and still no phone call. This is a disgrace!
column9: We were in store about 6pm. Sorry about the delay in replying. Have been out of the country.

column4: Your store at Shepherds Spring Lane refused to allow me to buy a bottle of wine today because I didn t have ID to prove I m 45. The 2 guys before me  no question. I m disgusted  and also a personal license holder. I asked for a supervisor and was told   no they leave it to our discretion. I suggest SHE should have gone to specsavers as i then went to Tescos.
column9: Sorry you weren't able to buy alcohol today Zoe. We ask our colleagues to follow our Think 25 policy, and once they've asked for ID this can't be overridden by a manager. Leigh

column4: Your store at Shepherds Spring Lane refused to allow me to buy a bottle of wine today because I didn t have ID to prove I m 45. The 2 guys before me  no question. column4: Just been in sainsburys st-annes. Turns out that you only need to have a child in your car to park in parent and child parking  you have absolutely no need to get them out of the car  even if it leaves people who are taking their young child out of the car in a normal space that does not have the extra room. I always was of the belief that the extra space was to make it easier to strap your child in as the door opens wider or space so the door opens wide enough to get a baby seat in and out. Turns out I m mistaken! Not happy  the child in question was 10 years old so needed no extra help in or out. NOT HAPPY AT THIS SITUATION AT ALL!  Also wondering why st-annes branch is supporting a food bank that will not help ANYONE in our area! We surprisingly and unfortunately have a foodbank in st-annes but for some reason they have chosen to support Blackpool foodbank despite of this. Blackpool foodbank WILL NOT help st-annes residents as it is a separate area to us even though it is only 3 miles to the border! They will only support Blackpool residents. Seems bizarre to me when we can support the local one.
column9: My eldest child is 18. Does that mean I can park in a space if he's with me?!

column4: So the result of some pen pushing number cruncher buyer in H/o is we have no  proper  potatoes to buy in my local store of Cwmbran!! Having two sections taken of them last week we have empty shelves today with no stock to replenish! They had the audacity to take away the organic salad potatoes (i have already put a request in for them to be put back!) they have also taken Maris Piper off us too! I think its about time these buyers got out of their cosy little office  throw their profit calculators in the bin and visit my local store to see what we want! You have to speak to your staff to find out and not rely on your weekly reports on paper! Now please put all our stock back!

column4: U need to get your staff to read up on the law concerning carrier bags. I was charged for a bag for my uncooked leaking package of chicken. column4: Hi.   I am against testing on animals and find it increasingly hard to find/locate products that are not tested on animals. What would be REALLY helpful would be if you could have a section of the cruelty free products you sell so that people like myself can go straight there instead of having to search around between all the other products to find the humane ones. Do you think there would be a possibility of this happening? I think think it would be welcomed with open arms by a lot of your customers.  Many thanks
column9: Thanks Megan, much appreciated. It would make it a lot easier to be able to go to a section and grab any product knowing it hadn't been tested on animals rather than having to trawl through all the shampoos, face washes, etc to find a brand that doesn't test on animals or to check all the labels. I have to say when I went to the Tunbridge Wells store the other day I couldn't find any shampoos/conditioners that hadn't been tested on animals.  Cheers!

column4: Hello sainsburys    As a loyal customer I am dissapointed to have to write to you about my latest online shop (order ref 36704442.)   Unfortunately you have failed on your freshness promise  the one thing that usually sets you apart from your competitors. The main bulk of my fresh groceries either expired the same day of the delivery or 1-2 days later! As much as my daughter loves carrot sticks and grapes she is only 3 & cannot eat the lot in 1 day! The carrot sticks were slimey  as were the egg noodles that went off on the day of purchase. None of the short dated produce was delivered in a blue bag to alert me and allow me the chance to send it back (which has been common practice in all of my previous deliveries.) It is only now  2 days later  that I have been forced to investigate the dates of all of the products having opened browning grapes this morning that turn out to have expired yesterday.   Most of my fresh meat and fish also have shorts dates. Forcing me to cook a dinner tonight consisting of salmon  prawns & chicken plus alot of wilting salad and vegetables  in order to not waste any of the food. This should have been 3 dinners for my family. I cannot afford to replace meals based on the incompetence of such a large  usually excellent  supermarket chain.   To top it all off the bread and fruit loaf were delivered squashed. Anyone with a 3 year old will understand that misshapen bread will not do for a sandwich (unless it s in the shape of a gingerbread man so the head can be bitten off!) It s difficult enough to satisfy the ever changing appetite of a toddler without slimey carrot sticks  gone off grapes and plates full of meat and fish.   On a positive note the delivery driver was extremely polite and friendly. Just a shame the vegetables weren t the same.  Yours sincerely  A very dissapointed customer.
column9: Very sorry you had such a bad experience Alicia! Can you PM us your order number, postcode and email address please? We'll look into this for you. Stephen.

column4: I have a question for Sainsbury s (and other food outlets).   The Conservative government is cutting disabled peoples benefits  sanctioning the unemployed and have made begging illegal (both the act of begging and the act of giving).   I am aware that Sainsbury s gives  out of date  produce to Foodbank (and others) to be distributed to the poor. However a person can (typically) only get 3 days of food from Foodbank.   So ... a poor and hungry person has few choices. Commit crime or starve.   What is Sainsbury s thoughts on this situation?  Would Sainsbury s attempt to prosecute a person stealing food?   Your reply  and the thoughts of others is most welcome.
column9: You want sainsburys to publically condone theft?

column4: Yesterday my daughter and I visited your Rustington store  in the hope of getting something to eat and picking up a purchase from the Argos shop in store.  As we approached the serving area of the cafe  we became aware of the sign saying the cafe closed at 7pm  and also that the time was 6.55pm. I asked the young man behind the counter if they were still serving hot food  fully expecting the answer to be no but after a quick glance to check with his co worker in the kitchen the young man said it was fine. I was very pleasantly surprised by this and would just like to say we thought it was very good customer service.  We enjoyed our meals when they arrived too  so thank you 😊
column9: That's lovely Yvonne, glad my colleagues could whip you up a tasty meal despite the time! Do you remember the name of the colleague who served you? I'd love to pass your praise over to the store management. Thanks, Kirsty

column4: It used to be that checkout staff would ask if you needed help with packing. Ever since the government s plastic bag charge that offer seems to have gone out the window. This afternoon I even requested the girl at checkout to assist me but she just shoved the bags to one side and waited for me to finish things off. Is this a new policy. I m sure staff must be delighted at not having to offer this extra chore.

column4: Hi Sainsburys  I just wanted to say that I used to do my regular shop at Tesco  but last year due to huge fails in customer service and horrid fresh meat and veg  I swapped to using Sainsburys as my regular supermarket  I get my shopping delivered due to having small children and every delivery I have had has been superb  the drivers have been the politest  friendliest and most helpful drivers I have ever had compared to Tesco and Asda  I have only ever had a few substitute items and they have been perfectly acceptable substitutes  it has always arrived on time and is fresh  I once had a cracked egg which was noticed by the driver as he checked them and I was refunded them  I have now got my mum shopping with you too as she feels let down by Tesco too. I also want to add that when I shop in store in Maidstone (town center  Aylesford and the small shop in Loose) I have been satisfied by politeness and helpfulness of staff and the products I have bought. I do sometimes visit your superstore in Ashford and have yet again been happy with my shopping experience. I just thought I would pop a good review here and say thanks cos many people (including myself at times) tend to use social media as a way to vent their issues with a company so I just wanted to try and even things out with a nice review. Please pass on this on to the relevant people at the Maidstone stores and delivery team. Thanks 😊☺
column9: Thanks for the kind words Charlotte, great to have you on board! Can you PM us an old order number along with your postcode and email address please? I'll pass your comments to the management team in store. Stephen.

column4: Working in customer service myself  I m all too aware that people are quick to say when something s wrong but not so quick to say when something s been done right. I ve just got back from your Mansfield store & it was the first time I d visited your cafe. I had my one year old in my arms and your cafe staff could not have been more helpful  they carried my tray  collected my knife & fork and asked me if there was anything else they could do to help. Then when I d finished  they saw me struggling to carry my little boy & put the highchairs away  so they came and did that too. I can not tell you how much this was really appreciated  particularly as I d been having a stressful morning with the little one in question! Thank you and well done on excellent customer service!
column9: Thanks for the great feedback! What time were you in store? I'll ensure your comments are passed on. Stephen.

column4: Horrified to see my local store (3rd Avenue  Letchworth) displaying large quantities of RoundUp (the weed killer closely linked to increased bee death in Europe  and cancer) at a discount. column9: Thanks for the heads up; I need some weedkiller for my driveway so that's great if it's discounted.

column4: Dear Sainsbury s - having been a loyal customer at your Cobham branch since it opened  I am both appalled and disgusted at the customer service from this store after a complaint following a home delivery this week. I am currently having to shop online  and had received a delivery on Monday this week. The fresh fruit was in a bruised and for me unacceptable condition  further the  fresh berries  costing £3.50 with a sell by date of the next day! I rang and complained  having been advised they would call me from my local store and deliver fresh product to me the next day. This did not happen.  A gentleman called my home saying he was sorry  and would speak to his manager. I was to receive a call  first thing today  for said delivery to be arranged - at 11am I have again called to make a further complaint  was put through to the store where a female (who declined to give her name) advised me  I am sorry about your  missing items   can you tell me what they were and we can deliver it to you  REALLY?????? Are you at all interested in  Customer Service ? She then became totally  un interested  when I attempted to explain  talking over me constantly  leaving me feeling like I NEVER want to shop at your store again - and will NEVER recommend it to anyone! Disgraceful service - we are your customers  PLEASE try to look after us.
column9: You too Annie - whatever happened to putting the customer first?

She then became totally  un interested  when I attempted to explain  talking over me constantly  leaving me feeling like I NEVER want to shop at your store again - and will NEVER recommend it to anyone! Disgraceful service - we are your customers  PLEASE try to look after us.
column9: Hi Cath, I am very sorry to hear this. Can you please DM me your order number, name, first line of address and telephone number on the account and I can look into this for you? Thanks. Monica.

column4: Dear Sainsbury s - having been a loyal customer at your Cobham branch since it opened  I am both appalled and disgusted at the customer service from this store after a complaint following a home delivery this week. I am currently having to shop online  and had received a delivery on Monday this week. The fresh fruit was in a bruised and for me unacceptable condition  further the  fresh berries  costing £3.50 with a sell by date of the next day! I rang and complained  having been advised they would call me from my local store and deliver fresh product to me the next day. This did not happen.  A gentleman called my home saying he was sorry  and would speak to his manager. I was to receive a call  first thing today  for said delivery to be arranged - at 11am I have again called to make a further complaint  was put through to the store where a female (who declined to give her name) advised me  I am sorry about your  missing items   can you tell me what they were and we can deliver it to you  REALLY?????? Are you at all interested in  Customer Service ? She then became totally  un interested  when I attempted to explain  talking over me constantly  leaving me feeling like I NEVER want to shop at your store again - and will NEVER recommend it to anyone! Disgraceful service - we are your customers  PLEASE try to look after us.
column9: I am having the exact same problem with their careless customer service! I complained on the 11th May about appalling click and collect service and I have had to chase them twice, I have heard nothing! Utterly unreasonable. I hope you get your case looked into further!

column4: Had my first online delivery today using the £20 of first order. Ok so that was good plus the two substitute items were well thought out organic replaced by normal and dove body wash for dove body wash with option to hand back at door and have credit refund to card. But what really impressed me was the delivery gentleman Ricky who was absolutely top notch. I would order again just because he was such a thoughtful and polite man who wanted to make sure I was aware and happy with everything. It would be nice if he got some kind of praise for his customer service it was a real 10/10. Well done Sainsbury s you have my order again.  Please inbox me if you need further info.

column4: When I moved house back in March i was worried about doing my food shop. I do not do weekly/monthly shops. I go every 1-2 days and buy 3-4 items that i need. But the problem is Bella  i didn t want to leave her alone in the house as its still a new environment for her. And I have to be honest  Sainsbury s have been fantastic.  I spoke to Michael (Duty Manager) & Marie (Customer Service Manager) and they said if i arrive at store just after they open (7am) i can ask a member of staff to go pick up a few bits for me while i wait outside with the dog. While that was fine  i was happy. it s improved.  There is a really nice women called Jill who will not only come outside the store  but hold s Bella while i go in  pick up a few bits of shopping  and another member of staff around the till area (Andy mainly) will just jump on a till so i don t need to mess about with self-scan too.  So if Jill is not working  i will just ask a member of staff to go get me a few bits  but if Jill is working  she will come hold Bella while I go in. I can t even try and explain how awesome she is.  Outstanding customer service!
column9: That's correct, it's Headingley :)

column4: Hi Sainsbury s. I m hoping you can give me a bit of guidance about an online shop I m trying to do. We re going away shortly  so I m trying to be super organised and sort a food shop for when we return (the 8th of June). I ve just logged in to my account  booked a slot for that day  and started added items as usual. However  I noticed that barely anything is showing as on offer? As we re on quite a tight budget we rely on these offers to form the bulk of our shop. Is this because I m trying to book so far in advance that the offers haven t been determined for that week yet  so aren t available? If this is the case  do you know when they will be available so I can complete the shop? Sadly  if this isn t the case  and it s just that there isn t much on offer  I m afraid I ll have to look at other options and I d really rather not do that :) Thanks in advance for your help!
column9: Hi Stephen, thanks for getting back to me. When will the offers for the week beginning the  6th be available, please? Is there a set day for offer changeover?

column4: I ve nipped to my local sainsburys on the way home from work and bought some precut turkey breasts. I ve got all ingredients ready to make a curry and I open the meat and there s what I can only describe as a part of a claw in there.  That s tea out of the window! Or rather in the bin. This is the second time in as many weeks that I ve found something other than the turkey and also the second time I ve had to throw ingredients out.  What a waste! I ll not be buying fresh meat from sainsburys again. What ever is in place to stop contamination is obviously not working! I feels that I need to buy two meal choices in case one of them is spoiled.  Not good Sainsburys 😠
column9: Yeah that's my thought too but it's so off putting and who knows which turkey it's come off.  Could have been slaughtered on a different day.  I'm just shocked it's happened again. I never complained last time as just assumed it was a one off even though last time the extra bit was all slimy 😷

column4: Really??? Can you please tell me why your company puts sugar in chicken liver parfait? I ve been trying to  Taste the Difference  but frankly all I can taste is sweetness. The ingredients list Madeira wine (3%)  sugar and caramalised sugar. I may be confused about this but I was under the impression that chicken liver parfait is not generally consumed as a desert and so does not need to be sweet. Come to think of it  I m not sure it needs pork fat as the second ingredient on the list either but that s a different story. If I m wrong  and you do intend this as a desert (its definitely sweet enough) could you please advise what you would pair it with. A dollop of squirty cream perhaps? Chocolate sauce?
column9: Thanks for the reply. I don't like sugar in foods that don't need it or shouldn't have it. I don't want to have to read the ingredients of every single item I buy and if an item comes under your apparently superior and definitely more expensive range then it should be composed of high quality, appropriate ingredients. I am sure that you are more than able to identify the barcode at your end.

column9: this is my complaint by email and letter: Dear Sirs  Complaint Notified by Email on 14 April 2016  I refer to my complaint made by email via your website on 14 April 2016, to which I have had not had the courtesy of a response.  Fortuitously, I kept a copy in draft which I set out below.  SENT ON THURSDAY 14 APRIL 2016 I have had a number of issues with the Pharmacy at your Tunbridge Wells store in the past and have complained previously (Feb 2014) but yesterday beggared belief. I apologise for the lengthy email but to say I am livid is an understatement.  I order my repeat prescriptions on line and they are delivered to the pharmacy.  I called on Tuesday to check that they had picked these up, there are several on a regular basis, they did not have them.  Someone took my number and said they would call me back.  They did not.  I called again on Wednesday and was told they did not have them.  I had been to my doctor's surgery in the morning and the nurse had confirmed they had all been signed for.  In addition to my repeat prescription I had ordered a supply of insulin which I had recently been prescribed and which was not yet on repeat.  The nurse confirmed this too had been put through the system.  To double check I call your pharmacy at 17.18 to ensure they had received all my prescriptions.  I was about to travel and needed the insulin.  Again I was told they had not received any prescriptions.  I called the surgery who confirmed that the prescriptions had been signed for by a member of the pharmacy team.  I called the pharmacy again who then confirmed they had the prescriptions but they were not ready yet.  I work in the City and said that was fine I would collect on my way home at about 7 pm.  I double-checked about the insulin and was advised this was fine.  I did not therefore ask my surgery to fax through that prescription.  Sainsbury’s is about a 15 minute walk for me from the train station.  I also suffer from COPD and arthritis so my walking is not particularly speedy.  I arrived at the pharmacy at about 7.10 pm.  The first issue is that although my bulk repeat was ready I had to remind the assistant, yet again, that there were additional items in the fridge.  I have to do this on a regular basis.  I do not think it is correct that I know more than your assistants about how to run the practice and check that everything is there.  We then got onto the subject of the insulin.  The pharmacist was adamant it had not been signed for.  He said there was nothing he could do and I would need to call 111.  He was most unhelpful and by this stage I was truly angry.  I am a Legal Executive and if I treated my clients in the way I was treated I would be sued for negligence and work would be placed elsewhere.  I had to leave the store to call 111 as there is no signal in the store.  I arranged for an out of hours doctor to call me and was advised it could take up to two hours.  I had no alternative but to walk home which is all uphill knowing I would have to return in a couple of hours.  I had a lot to do yesterday evening to get ready for my trip.  This delay set me back considerably.   It gets worse.  111 called me very quickly and we arranged for the prescription to be faxed to your pharmacy.  I then tried to call the store 4 times when it rang and rang and then went to fax.  The fifth time I got through but was then cut off.  On the sixth attempt I finally got through to the pharmacy and was advised that unfortunately they did not have the insulin there.  Why on earth they could not have told me that when I was in the store I cannot comprehend.  I then had to drive from Tunbridge Wells to Tonbridge to a pharmacy at East Street to collect my prescription.  I eventually got home, having not eaten (not the best option for a diabetic), not packed, not sorted and so livid it took me a good hour to calm my stress levels down to actually start prepping for the trip.  This is simply unacceptable service on even the most basic of levels.  Not only did I lose time at work trying to sort the issue out so I would not have a problem, I then lost further time dealing with staff that was uninformed or unhelpful.  Then, to compound that, I had to drive 10 miles there and 10 miles back to collect my prescription.  Needless to say I WILL NOT EVER be using the pharmacy service at your Tunbridge Wells store again.  In fact, on an entirely separate note I will endeavour not to frequent your store at all.  On the last 3/4 occasions when I have attended to do my weekly shop there is a marked lack of any fresh fruit available.  I usually shop on a Saturday morning when I would expect the shelves to be filled.  The standard of fruit and veg which I always thought was very good has deteriorated to a marked degree.  I await your comments. I await hearing from you by return.  I may be contacted on my personal email address.  I believe you have my work email but I would prefer this exchange to be kept entirely separate.

column4: I would like to know more about this product  I never noticed I had to COOK it first in the microwave  as 99% of dog foods you just feed n go. So now I have a poorly doggy with very bad diarrhea - please let me know if there are any nasties in there that would be killed by cooking  that I have accidentally now fed to my dog. I am not a happy customer  as the cooking instructions are small on the back and I think if its like that it should say  Cooking Required  on the front of the pack seeing as it flies in the face of most other dog foods.  Please let me know what I have potentially given my dog - many thanks - Helen
column9: Hi Helen, we've heard back from our product technologist who advised that the product doesn’t require cooking. We give the option for the customer to ‘warm’ the meal in the microwave for a short time should they want to however the product is perfectly safe and acceptable to eat without doing this. The product has been heat processed at the manufacturers to a level that would remove all harmful bacteria. This has been done to an independently verified method meeting all legal and safety requirements. In addition, we regularly assess the microbiological quality of our products and have not identified any issues. Hope this helps, Danny.

column9: Hi Helen, I'm really sorry that your dog is feeling poorly. I've requested further information from our product technologists about this, and once we have an update on this, we'll be back in touch. Danny

column4: I have been a customer of Sainsbury s for over 50 years and in the last few years I have experienced a great lack of service. Yesterday I was at  y Winchmore Hill Store  where I spend a lot of of money every week. I asked for help in packing and a very nice Lady came to help. the cashier called EUNICE   however  continued to talk to a collegue and very slowly attended to the shopping. I had just walked  for 50 mins. To the store and another 40 mins around the store. I was very tired  having had a knee replacement recently and I kindly asked her if she could continue her conversation with her friend later on and see to my shopping.  I did not hear what EUNICE said but could imagine it. When paying I apologised to her and said I was sorry for having to mention it about her service but she was also just ignoring me and nearly throwing the store card at me.  instead of accepting my apology ( which I did. Not even need to make but I am w very nice person and have always treated every shop assistant all my life with friendliness because this is how I like being treated) she started mouthing off to her next 2 customers about me. I was then verbally abused by these LADIES ??? I hope somebody at Sainsbury read this and will answer to me. I did report EUNICE and I am thinking of buying at WAITROSE from now on
column9: I reported it to one your supervisors , a lady who has been with you for many years and customer service listened to it as well. It must have been  around 2 pm yesterday.

column4: Really disappointed in Sainsbury s home delivery lately. My mom ordered her shopping on Friday at 17.00 to be delivered on Saturday  Saturday came but our shopping didn t. She checked her account and it showed she hadn t booked a delivery slot so again she booked it  this time for Sunday. Sunday arrived but once again no shopping  same thing apparently no delivery slot booked. I booked her slot for Monday  I screenshot the page showing it was booked and low and behold  Monday arrives but no shopping!!!!!! Such an inconvenience we organised our days to make sure we were in for the delivery slots for no reason! When my mom spoke to customer service all they could say is it would be delivered on Tuesday  not even an apology! We had to go shopping on the weekend when it s too busy to think and to be honest we didn t want to. Thanks for the rubbish customer service!!
column9: Did you check out your order after booking the slot, Clarice,  you should have received an email confirming  your order and delivery date and time , immediately after placing the order. The order needs to be checked out after any amendment,

column9: My name is John-Kenneth.  I am  surprised at your reply and attempt to pass the buck to your insurance company. Why not take some responsibility to try and help rectify the situation. After-all  it was a big orange Sainsbury's van driven by a Sainsbury's uniformed employee that collided with our home.  Maybe you should impress upon Gallagher Bassett (as they are employed to be the representatives of your brand) and get them to rectify the situation. Eight weeks without repair or updates without me having to request them is unacceptable.  My wife and I are both Nectar card holders and most of our food and fuel shopping is with your company. I wonder how much longer for?

column4: It has been over eight weeks since one of your delivery vans destroyed our balcony and whilst delivering to a neighbour. Any chance of pressuring your insurance company so that it can be fixed soon? We have been quite patient so far.

column4: It has been over eight weeks since one of your delivery vans destroyed our balcony and whilst delivering to a neighbour. Any chance of pressuring your insurance company so that it can be fixed soon? We have been quite patient so far.
column9: Liz;  Again - My name is John-Kenneth; not John.   Perhaps if I help by posting up some photos of the damage, and of your van and company logo it might help Sainsbury's to take some responsibility to help to resolve the situation? I could maybe ask the local press to help too?  They are options I don't really wan't to take but I am fed up of being ignored and passed from pillar to post.  Has Sainsbury's  made any attempt to contact Gallagher to ask them the current situation? Have you given them a nudge to try and move things along a bit?  Rather than "Procedures need to be followed". Procedures have been followed and it has fallen into to a black hole of "It's not out fault it's the fault of....." Choose an option of one of many excuses: i.e.  a) another parties fault, b) the contractors, c) the man that measured it, d) the delivery of materials etc. etc. etc.   Your driver admitted it was his fault at the time and Gallagher have admitted liability.  Do you not think a better answer would be "We have listened to your complaint and we will work with Gallagher to resolve the situation as quickly possible and have spoken to PERSON X. I will get a senior Sainsbury's manager to contact you directly to help find a resolution. Sorry this has caused you so much inconvenience and distress. Is there anything else we can do to help at the moment?".  It seems that Sainsbury's has no interest or understanding of the dissatisfaction of a long term and regular customer.

They are damaging Sainsbury's brand and reputation.  All I am trying to do it get Sainsbury's to also contact Gallagher to get them to resolve the situation. Surely this is why Sainsbury's pay them?  Being told ""we can not intervene"" is not acceptable. They are agents of your company.  To whom can I escalate this matter to a more senior Sainsbury's representative that will take some time and responsibility to understand the situation, give me a single Sainsbury's point of contact, and realise that there is a really dissatisfied customer and provide me some reassurance that all can be done is being done?

column4: Dear Store Manager   I’m writing to complain about Sainsbury’s stocking John West Tuna.  Sainsbury’s has been ranked in the top 3 of Greenpeace’s league tables for the past 5 years. I am writing now to ask that Sainsbury’s takes responsibility for the sustainability of all tuna tins on your shelves - not just your own brand.  You know that John West have broken their commitment to clean up their supply chain. Despite this  you continue to stock their unsustainable tuna  caught using large nets associated with Fish Aggregating Devices  a method that causes indiscriminate harm to marine life  and notably to endangered species such as sharks and turtles.  Sainsbury’s has been helping lead the way toward a sustainable tuna market in the UK. But in the last two weeks  Tesco and Waitrose said they could drop John West if they don’t reach high sustainability standards and renounce this destructive fishing method. I would expect nothing less from Sainsbury’s.  I sincerely hope you will take action to ensure Sainsbury’s is selling 100% sustainable tuna.  Regards                 Rick Cunningham

column9: We are the UK’s leading retailer for sustainable fish, and we’re proud that Greenpeace has given us recognition over the years for the sustainable sourcing of all of our own brand canned tuna. 100% of our By Sainsbury's, Taste the Difference and Basics canned tuna is caught using pole and line. We have made great progress to extend this further to products such as sandwiches, sushi and ready meals.  We expect every one of our suppliers to take a responsible approach to sourcing.  John West is working in partnership with WWF and has set out a number of goals to drive up its sustainability status by the end of 2018. We are monitoring its progress very closely, we continue to maintain an ongoing dialogue with them on this important issue and will act accordingly if this is not fulfilled.

column4: !!! PLEASE SHARE !!! DO NOT USE SAINSBURY BANK!   I applied for a credit card with Sainsbury s 3 weeks ago and sent my driver’s licence and proof of address to the Card Services team. The card team confirmed my photographic ID is scanned onto your system and I have a letter from the bank stating Sainsbury’s had it so either its lost on someone’s desk or an employee has stolen it! column4: Yesterday I had a fry up in the Hastings sainsburys café for the first time   firstly the food took 40 mins to come out other people who had been waiting longer went up to complain but we waited until it came out . There was only one waiter so they were obviously under staffed so it s clear to see that they were rushed off there feet tying to complete orders but obviously not cooking the food properly . When my food came out the sausages looked burnt but stupidly I still ate them (the worst choice I made by far) as they gave me food poisoning to the point were I was being violently sick with diarrhea and shaking    food poisoning was confirmed by the doctor as your food was the only thing I ate that day that would have given me food poisoning . I am so disgusted with the poor quality of food and at the time I waited for my food that 13 hours later made me so ill I and my family will never eat at your restaurant again and this has unfortunately put me off fry ups for life. So thanks very much sainsburys I hope no one else gets as ill as I did from your poor quality of cooking.

column4: As a mother of two children  one of those being a new born baby and me being just home after surgery I thought a home delivery would be most convenient seeing as though I m unable to leave the house to do my shopping for myself. How wrong was I. My shopping was booked for delivery between 5pm-6pm  I was left a voicemail at 5.20 saying my shopping was not going to be delivered and asked to callback which I did almost straight away. I was told that the driver had a personal emergency and had to go home  therefore my shopping would not be delivered. I told the very unhelpful man on the phone this wasn t acceptable and explained my situation  he went on to say there wasn t anything he could do. I then asked to speak to a manager  I was put through to a manager and was told that he would look into it and call me back. At 8.30pm I still hadn t heard anything so I called sainsburys again  I explained who I was and was told very rudely........ An I quote  yeah  I spoke to you earlier and told you there was nothing we could do an there s still nothing we can do  you will have to re book your delivery or get a refund  I explained to the extremely rude man on the phone that I didn t want to speak to him an asked that he put me through to the manager i had spoken to earlier. The rude man put me through without saying anything leading me to believe he had hung up on me. I spoke to the same manager again (dean) and was told that he had asked someone to contact me earlier an he apologised that they hadn t. Again we discussed my predicament and he s said he would contact me within 10 minutes (I asked dean to find out the rude mans name for me) dean the manager called me back 5 minutes later and said he would book my delivery for first thing the next day and assured me I would have my shopping by 8.30am at the latest  here s hoping! Dean also told me that the rude staff members name was Adam. I am utterly disgusted with the way Adam spoke to me and left disappointed with the lack of service provided by sainsburys! Surely sainsburys should have some sort of contingency plan in place for such  emergencies  as I m sure I wasn t the only customer let down by sainsburys today.
column9: All Done. Casey

column4: As a mother of two children  one of those being a new born baby and me being just home after surgery I thought a home delivery would be most convenient seeing as though I m unable to leave the house to do my shopping for myself. How wrong was I. My shopping was booked for delivery between 5pm-6pm  I was left a voicemail at 5.20 saying my shopping was not going to be delivered and asked to callback which I did almost straight away. I was told that the driver had a personal emergency and had to go home  therefore my shopping would not be delivered. I told the very unhelpful man on the phone this wasn t acceptable and explained my situation  he went on to say there wasn t anything he could do. I then asked to speak to a manager  I was put through to a manager and was told that he would look into it and call me back. At 8.30pm I still hadn t heard anything so I called sainsburys again  I explained who I was and was told very rudely........ The rude man put me through without saying anything leading me to believe he had hung up on me. I spoke to the same manager again (dean) and was told that he had asked someone to contact me earlier an he apologised that they hadn t. Again we discussed my predicament and he s said he would contact me within 10 minutes (I asked dean to find out the rude mans name for me) dean the manager called me back 5 minutes later and said he would book my delivery for first thing the next day and assured me I would have my shopping by 8.30am at the latest  here s hoping! Dean also told me that the rude staff members name was Adam. I am utterly disgusted with the way Adam spoke to me and left disappointed with the lack of service provided by sainsburys! Surely sainsburys should have some sort of contingency plan in place for such  emergencies  as I m sure I wasn t the only customer let down by sainsburys today.
column9: Hi Casey, apologies for the inconvenience caused. I've looked into your case and we managed to arrange a special delivery via sidewinder on one of our routes between 8am and 9am today, which is within the timescale from what you've advised me. I'm sorry that it didn't arrive when you were expecting it. I've issued a £10 e-voucher to apologise and made sure this is addressed by the store management team. Ryan.

column9: Hi Catherine, these are packaged by weight, not by portion or size. Thanks, Ryan.

column4: Why when you buy pre packed fish for two people or 2 lamb shanks in a packet are they never the same size  my lamb shank today had one tiny one and one medium size one   surely they could pack them with the same size.
column9: They have to make up the stated weight of the pack, so if you have one medium to large size  piece weighing more than half the pack , they have to use a smaller piece for the second person.

column4: Why when you buy pre packed fish for two people or 2 lamb shanks in a packet are they never the same size  my lamb shank today had one tiny one and one medium size one   surely they could pack them with the same size.

column4: I work for Sainsbury’s Low Hall store. I am posting this through a friend’s wall. Due to the fact many people are getting sacked or disciplinary for speaking out. As the manager we have is a dictator.  Due to the management not being able to manage well and not being able to keep an eye on their staff they have come to a conclusion of totally banning hot drinks and water and food on a shop floor as they think maybe its stolen  yet some colleagues are told they are allowed bottles of water where as others are told to bring sports bottles. Also not allowed to have other company brands of water etc.  It s one rule for one department and another for other departments. People of the tills are allowed bottles. Online shoppers come down with hot drinks. People working in the night with ACs on working in the cold or just need a drink to keep them awake are not allowed. Working all night to deliver a shop that will benefit the sales of the store. Yet we are the ones that are limited and been made to feel as we are prisoners.   Breaks are taken in two groups so people are rushing to use the microwaves causing delays in warming ones food and rushing the food. If someone goes 2 minutes over they get warning letters. We don’t even have time for desserts or a tea after eating.  There have been occasions where managers from other departments have told off colleagues in such a rude manor in front of customers about hot drinks.  I have been working here over 10 years and these problems have started to occur ever since Jonathan Cooke and Jibran Khan got moved to Low Hall. column4: I work for Sainsbury’s Low Hall store. I am posting this through a friend’s wall. Due to the fact many people are getting sacked or disciplinary for speaking out. As the manager we have is a dictator.  Due to the management not being able to manage well and not being able to keep an eye on their staff they have come to a conclusion of totally banning hot drinks and water and food on a shop floor as they think maybe its stolen  yet some colleagues are told they are allowed bottles of water where as others are told to bring sports bottles. Also not allowed to have other company brands of water etc.  It s one rule for one department and another for other departments. People of the tills are allowed bottles. Online shoppers come down with hot drinks. People working in the night with ACs on working in the cold or just need a drink to keep them awake are not allowed. Working all night to deliver a shop that will benefit the sales of the store. Yet we are the ones that are limited and been made to feel as we are prisoners.   Breaks are taken in two groups so people are rushing to use the microwaves causing delays in warming ones food and rushing the food. If someone goes 2 minutes over they get warning letters. We don’t even have time for desserts or a tea after eating.  There have been occasions where managers from other departments have told off colleagues in such a rude manor in front of customers about hot drinks.  I have been working here over 10 years and these problems have started to occur ever since Jonathan Cooke and Jibran Khan got moved to Low Hall.  In the rush of changing things they have forgotten that we are the ones who are the most important part of running the store in terms of stocking shelves and making sure all the products are on the shelf for customers  instead of working with us we are made to feel like slaves being. Mr Khan is a very very rude arrogant man he is also a pervert. He intimidates people and if you speak back you get suspended. He does not listen and interrupts you when you want to speak and starts getting defensive. We should not be made to feel intimidated or bullied or pressurized at work when we work as hardest as we can to deliver the best.   Every year since he started people are unable to get Christmas  Eid or Diwali off. He picks and chooses who he wants to give it too.  Managers never help out if there is a shortage of staff yet they harass us to work like donkeys. Many people have claimed that Mr Khan said he gets paid to do nothing.  There have been occasions where Mr Cooke has made sarcastic comments about work being done slow or messy we take pride in our work but it s a disappointment when there is no faith in us.  Majority off the staff feels like this and want something being done. Preferably a transfer of manager or them to be demoted so the status doesn’t make them into hitler.   They yearly feed back is never anonymous as they sit there watching us what we write. The staff turnover is increasing for a reason.
column9: Quality.....😂^^^^

column4: I would like to know if any of the food in your stores have GMO ingredients - I am so happy that Waitrose have decided not tp stock food with GMO ingredients - are you planning to keep your customers informed or shall we start shopping elsewhere ????
column9: Hi there we do not permit the sale of own brand food, drink, pet food, dietary supplements or floral products that contain GM material.    We are also aware that some customers have concerns regarding products from animals that may have been fed a diet containing GM material. As part of offering a choice to our customers, we offer a range of own brand organic products which guarantees the animals are fed a non-GM diet.  We appreciate that customers want to know about our sourcing policies, however, we do not put information about feed source on our packaging. If you'd like more details about our sourcing policies you can find this on our website at www.j-sainsbury.co.uk. Robbie

column4: A question on the labelling of the whole bass on the fish counter. At the bottom of the label  in the smallest print  it states  farmed in Turkey  but more clearly  in larger print it claims  packed in U.K.  Clearly there is no packaging on the fish that are laid out on a bed of ice and I m guessing they weren t sent over from Turkey live in a vat of sea water and would have been in packaging to prevent contamination  hence  unpacked in the U.K.  would be more correct. Are you trying to fool people into thinking the fish originate from our shores or is this a case of mislabelling due to  human error ?
column9: Fraser... It says ""packed in the UK"", not ""will be packed"" or ""to be packed"" or even ""can be packed""... Indeed, it has nothing to suggest any future tense whatsoever. It is a past tense suggesting the packing has already taken place.   When did you migrate across from the Morrisons page to Sainburys? Or do you troll all of the Supermarket visitor post pages? I feel terribly sorry for you if that's how sad your life is.   I'm struggling to remember the last supermarket post a friend of mine has made or commented on where your name hasn't also popped up with some pedantic and Ill though out rubbish.

column4: I am utterly APPAULLED  at the behaviour & attitude of one of your delivery drivers on our drive this morning at around 10.45  not only did he hit & dislodge one of our garden pots at least 3 times trying to turn a huge van in a very tight awkward drive  which he didn t manage anyway   (and I am sure he has done on numerous occasions  that is why I decided to take photographs to see if it WAS him and it most certainly was)  and I believe it will be the same driver who only a  matter of weeks ago broke 2/3 patio slabs on a neighbours drive & denied it  but I had take a photo of his lorry then too as I thought it was parked too close to her house. My husband went out to ask him not to try to turn his lorry because he hits the pots & he outright denied it :O my husband told him I d taken photographs & he turned round & said  you can t do anything about it unless you have a photograph of my face! :O what kind of attitude is that? I I do have a photograph of the lorry registration though). I hope all your drivers don t have such disregard for other peoples property as he appears to have  damage costs money & why should Sainsbury s expect people to pay for damage caused by some of their arrogant disrespectful drivers? I don t even get a Sainsbury s delivery it was my neighbours  but I do shop there sometimes & thankfully the store staff have far better attitudes than your delivery drivers.

Christmas! yeayee" seriously, perhaps you want to have an argument that is not intellectually insulting?unless you are that naive?!; I am not saying the producer hasn't got a responsibility but guess what, Sainsbury's are paying! they place the order! the producer want the money cause they want to stay in business. The supplier supplies what the order is. IF sainsbury's says recyclable then it will be so - i would expect there is a higher cost to this and it is Sainsbury's to accept to pay more. in this instance the big guy can use it clout to force a change - and hopefully not negatively to the margins of the small producer. and its 'you're' not 'your' , but then again perhaps I should talk to your teacher for teaching you poor spelling and not you?
