column4: Would like to say after shopping at sainsbury for years also using online shopping. I will not be shopping again. Your customer service is bad you re delivery service is crap.
column9: Really sorry about that Barbara. Can you PM us some more information please? Amanda.

column4: Hi Sainsbury s  I would just like to praise the staff at Bracknell s Bagshot Road branch today. I had to go in to take some bits back for Click & Collect.  However there was another customer giving them hell about Maris Piper potatoes. From what I could work out  the fresh produce lad has brought out every last bag of MP potatoes and none was good enough for Mrs high almighty. The customer service staff had put various calls out- but nothing was good enough. How the staff kept their cool I ll never know but she was rude and disrespectful and even interrupted my transaction with the staff member. In the end the manager was called at her request- from what I could see she was getting very animated and irate with the manager. The staff were clearly upset  but kept their professionalism at all times  they are a credit to you. I d have told her to leave the branch. They can t select what arrives in branch- not do they have control over what s grown!!  Bless them- big thumbs up to all involved 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼 in #SPUDGATE.
column9: Thank you- I've also posted my praise on local Facebook pages. Everyone is behind the staff members. Nobody goes to work to be spoken to like that. If she complains to HO I'd happily stand up for the staff members. She was bang out of order and old enough to know better. 🙈

column4: I ve just had an email confirming that an item from my home shopping has been refunded. It was a substitute item. Do you always send this email out to confirm a refund? If not I have been overcharged at least £20 over the course of several shops!
column9: No, there have been many substitutions I have turned down , one was when I ordered little packets of easter eggs which were two for a pound and they were substituted for expensive ones etc.. a bag of kinder eggs for a pound that was substituted for actual big kinder eggs... the substitutions there came to about £10  on one order and I have checked my emails carefully and have never had a refund confirmation before. The other times it would have been little bits here and there but, I have refused substitutions on a quite few occasions.

column4: I ve just had an email confirming that an item from my home shopping has been refunded. It was a substitute item. Do you always send this email out to confirm a refund? If not I have been overcharged at least £20 over the course of several shops!
column9: I need to go out but, could you please look into this further for me

column4: I ve just had an email confirming that an item from my home shopping has been refunded. It was a substitute item. Do you always send this email out to confirm a refund? If not I have been overcharged at least £20 over the course of several shops!
column9: No problem at all Yazz, I'll see what I can find out for you. Can you PM me your order number and the full name on the account please? Ryan.

column4: I ve just had an email confirming that an item from my home shopping has been refunded. It was a substitute item. Do you always send this email out to confirm a refund? If not I have been overcharged at least £20 over the course of several shops!
column9: Will do now :)

column4: I ve just had an email confirming that an item from my home shopping has been refunded. It was a substitute item. Do you always send this email out to confirm a refund? If not I have been overcharged at least £20 over the course of several shops!
column9: Hi Yazz, if you refused any substitutions you may receive a notification to confirm a refund however if you've accepted substitutions in your order there would be nothing to refund as we will scan the substitution through in absence of the original product, therefore charging you correctly. I hope this helps. Ryan.

column4: Did you receive my email I did via your website??? There was no confirmation (after ten attempts) and with every box filled..... so here it is:-   To start with  I am talking about the Barkingside store off the High Street  NOT the Newbury Park  store (I don’t have a car  I never shop there).  WHY does not the Barkingside store stock your Black Seedless Grapes (from South Africa) any longer?  I AM A regular buyer of your seedless Black grapes  not just for me but also for a relative who is currently in hospital (they always sell out by about Noon each day  so they are clearly very popular).   According to the (very helpful) Assistant I spoke to today (Wednesday 11 th May)  he said it was the Manager’s decision not to stock this line any longer. WHY?? I( suspect you were trying to get us to buying the Seedless Red grapes. P{lease note: compared to the Black grapes  the Red ones are rubbish.  Furthermore  the Assistant also mentioned that I was the Third person to have asked him about the Black Grapes. [Ask yourself this: does this strike you as an unpopular line???]. The manager at Barkingside clearly needs to know what sells in his store. [[It is clear to me that he is not fit for purpose]]  I’m not even sure why I am sending this  nobody listens to the customer any longer  least of all the manager of the Barkingside branch (no wonder we do our shopping at Lidl and Aldi now). I despair of Sainsbury (and I shall shortly be an Ex-Customer of Sainsbury).
column9: Wow

column4: Just wanted to give a shout out to a really helpful operator on the Customer Service Desk at the Hempstead Valley store today (Wednesday). Having been given one of your Hoovers as an Xmas present last year  it suddenly packed up mid hoover yesterday and no amount of intervention and fuse swapping would fix it. A nightmare more than normal  as I have an open house on Saturday to try and sell my property! I duly phoned the laughably named Electrical Support Team  who appear to be just another version of customer service  offering no advice and refusing to help without a proof of purchase. No receipt available... Arghhh!  I went to the store  with the person who purchased it today  to see if they would be able to trace it back using the SKU and her card number  but without hesitance or quibble  she simply exchanged it and even kept the replacement in its large box behind the counter until we had finished shopping. She was polite  smiley and more than willing to do that bit extra for her customers - a true example of what you expect from a Customer Service colleague.  My faith was restored after an extremely unhelpful and frustrating interaction with the  electrical support team   Y A happy customer  now  with a fully operational hoover  (operator details: S00556 / C1015)
column9: Really pleased my colleague could help, it's always lovely to hear! I've made sure this has been fed back to the store management team. We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know. Kirsty

column4: Hello  please can you get this message back to the store manager at Sainsbury s Basingstoke superstore and petrol station.  About an hour ago I drove off from the petrol pump leaving my wallet on the roof of my car and your staff at the petrol station and store were absolute lifesavers!!!!  Please can you acknowledge them for there excellent customer service and just for simply being amazing people!!!  They went above and beyond to help me when I returned to the petrol station distraught that I had lost my wallet with £500 of euros in it (all my savings) and my driving licence and my bank cards etc when I am due to leave on the ferry tomorrow for my holiday to Belgium. My holiday would have been ruined and I would not only have lost all that money but also I would have been unable to go at all without my driving licence and bank card.   I was utterly gutted and in pieces and when i explained the situation to the staff in the petrol station (I believe there names were Jane and Natasha  sorry if I have got them wrong as I was in a bit of a state) they went far above and beyond there job to help me.  Natasha checked the Cctv with Jane and they found my car leaving and we could see the wallet on the roof as I drove out so Jane came out with me up and down the road searching the bushes and roundabout for my wallet.   Meanwhile Natasha phoned the main store to see if they had it handed in. Well when myself and Jane returned empty handed I was totally a mess as we couldn t find it and was met by Natasha at the petrol station who was smiling and said good news  it had been handed in at the main store.  I simply broke down as I was sure my holiday (the first one I could afford in 3 years) was ruined and these lady s at the petrol station and the customer service team in the main store and the amazing people whoever they were that had handed it in all deserve medals!  They went out of there way to help and care and they really are great people so please can you give them any kind of award on my behalf as without these people I just don t know what I would have done. They are stars and you should be proud and honoured to have such super people working for you and shopping with you it shows your really have the best staff and customers!  I thank them and your customer who handed it in from the bottom of my heart. There are some great people in this world and you have some great customers and fantastic staff.  Leon Hill
column9: Nicely said and your lucky star was in its ascendancy- now hang on to your wallet and have a ball!

column9: Oh my goodness, I'm really pleased my colleagues could help & your wallet was returned safe! I recently lost my purse & it was a nightmare. To ensure this is fed back to the right team, can you confirm if this is the correct store: http://bit.ly/1OnXH0J? It's the only one I can see with a petrol station! Thanks, Kirsty

column4: Hello  please can you get this message back to the store manager at Sainsbury s Basingstoke superstore and petrol station.  About an hour ago I drove off from the petrol pump leaving my wallet on the roof of my car and your staff at the petrol station and store were absolute lifesavers!!!!  Please can you acknowledge them for there excellent customer service and just for simply being amazing people!!!  They went above and beyond to help me when I returned to the petrol station distraught that I had lost my wallet with £500 of euros in it (all my savings) and my driving licence and my bank cards etc when I am due to leave on the ferry tomorrow for my holiday to Belgium. My holiday would have been ruined and I would not only have lost all that money but also I would have been unable to go at all without my driving licence and bank card.   I was utterly gutted and in pieces and when i explained the situation to the staff in the petrol station (I believe there names were Jane and Natasha  sorry if I have got them wrong as I was in a bit of a state) they went far above and beyond there job to help me.  Natasha checked the Cctv with Jane and they found my car leaving and we could see the wallet on the roof as I drove out so Jane came out with me up and down the road searching the bushes and roundabout for my wallet.   Meanwhile Natasha phoned the main store to see if they had it handed in. Well when myself and Jane returned empty handed I was totally a mess as we couldn t find it and was met by Natasha at the petrol station who was smiling and said good news  it had been handed in at the main store.  I simply broke down as I was sure my holiday (the first one I could afford in 3 years) was ruined and these lady s at the petrol station and the customer service team in the main store and the amazing people whoever they were that had handed it in all deserve medals!  They went out of there way to help and care and they really are great people so please can you give them any kind of award on my behalf as without these people I just don t know what I would have done. They are stars and you should be proud and honoured to have such super people working for you and shopping with you it shows your really have the best staff and customers!  I thank them and your customer who handed it in from the bottom of my heart. There are some great people in this world and you have some great customers and fantastic staff.  Leon Hill

column4: Sainsburys !!  Still completely disgusted at the level of customer service I have received.  You take 3 payments out of my account when your card reader said   payment declined   Then when I complain I m kept for over 40 minutes to resolve the issue ( your issue )  Then you say it s going to take 5 days to re credit my account  then when I post my thoughts on your web page I get a response saying   your looking into it and will keep me updated   two further prompts without response !!!!  Your customer service is disgraceful !!!  I will be making a formal complaint.
column9: All I hope is that there will be an investigation and this doesn't happen to anyone else. If I were on a minimum wage that would of been a real issue !

column4: I don t usually post things like this but I was so touched by the service  I think the staff at Sainsburys  Arnos Vale  Bristol deserve a thank you and some recognition... My 5 week old baby decided she needed food NOW whilst we were trying to pay; the cashier jumped to my rescue to unload the trolley and pack my bags  the waitress in the cafe bought me iced water whilst I was doing an emergency breastfeed and another cashier helped me to the car covering said baby with cardboard boxes to protect from the torrential rain that welcomed us outside!!! What could easily have been a nightmare was saved by some lovely people... Thank you  I didn t get any of your names unfortunately but I hope you know that you saved a very flustered new mum! xx
column9: Thanks Kirsty. It was the Castle Court branch (St Philips Causeway, Bristol) and about 3.30pm x

column9: Watchdog IS the media; it's just a television show.  They have no powers.  I can't understand why people with genuine issues don't go to the agencies with genuine statutory enforcement powers.  They will tend not to give you 15 minutes of fame or offer vouchers/compo but will do all they can to resolve the situation.  Your Local Authority has statutory powers.  Depending on your issue, consumer advice/assistance will fall within the remit of the Trading Standards service.  It's not as exciting as a TV show but they have statutory powers at their disposal.

column9: Sainsbury's No I am not! Do you expect me to leave my child alone and walk to the car park at 5.50am??! I have time coded photos taken from my window. Funnily in exactly the same spot a 6.50am divert took place today. And, yes, this morning it was 6.50am! Funny that!! Do you think I'm making this up? They have had complaints, I know of at least 3 people! One of whom is part of the Friends of Brockenhurst neighbourhood society. NFDC have received over 30 complaints about it. Arla Dairy admitted delivering to your store way before the 7am curfew. And a member of staff admitted they are there from 6am and accept deliveries. Yes, I'm sure there are other culprits, however this only started to occur daily when you opened. Tesco's do not need to come into the village car park, they have there own. They are also banned from receiving deliveries before 7am (the same issue occurred with them, they stopped) That's me never shopping in your store again and my Nectar card cut up. If they could just fess up and change it, that'd be nice.

column4: Complaint  Visited your Rayleigh store in essex today! I tried to get a spot in the child and parent spaces near the front but none were available  I managed to park just opposite the spaces (for reference of where the problem is). My car was therefore near the front  i didnt spot the pot holes on the way in as its not my usual store.    The road is terrible  very large holes all over the place and unavoidable with a trolly as u try and miss one but hit another. It was very rainy today and my trolly went right into a deep hole! My 17 month old  3 year old and myself received such a jolt!   The trolly was stuck with both wheels in the hole in the blasted road!  Not only did we all get a shock but iv now pulled my back (sacroiliac injury now hurting again) from trying to haul the thing out the pot hole. If my kids were hurt id be absolutely livid. Sort out your carpark sainsburys before someone really hurts themselves. Also tried to contact your online chat regarding this but no one came online!

column4: Appalling customer service.... On Sunday  8th may I was at my local store in leigh and after finishing my shop I went to pay on my card where I was informed (after the 1st attempt) there was a problem and the card was declined. The problem being in store  staff was trying to get the card to work on different tills where I was informed it was happening to others aswell. Not bothered at all at what happened I left the store happy. Monday morning I went to the bank and had the shock of my life (monday morning still half asleep) when funds had gone. After a conversation with my bank I found out I had been charged 5 times for the Sunday shop. I phoned the local store and was put through to the department manager and in the conversation he assured me that they where aware of the problem as it wasn t a isolated incident and promised us our money would be back with us by the end of Monday. Happy with this promise and still finding the funny side we left the issue alone and continued our day. Later Monday afternoon the manager phoned us back saying IT was aware and again assured us the money will be in our bank that day. Tuesday may 10th (our rent day) the funds not returned landlord charge for late rent bank charges for bounced standing order. Not happy at all. Phoned the store again and was put to a different manager as the man I spoke with yesterday was of (no issues with that everyone deserves days off) after explaining everything to him he apologized and gave me the customer service phone number as they will help.....  So I phone CUSTOMER SERVICES. wow after fully explaining what had happened  I was replied  sorry we know what happened you ll be paid back in 5working days  I explained again what happened and due to a failed promise from management (that we put our trust in) we had incurred charges was no longer happy with this and would like to speak to a CUSTOMER SERVICE manager replied  I ve said what will happen and no   after confirming the reply mainly the being told no to speaking to a manager the woman on the phone just said  no  a hung the phone up! What. This is your customer service? Management can make false promises regardless and very rude customer service  not a happy customer at all.
column9: I am very sorry about this Camilla. I can completely understand why you are frustrated about this issue. I would like to address both the initial refund issue as well as the customer service issue. Can you please PM what time you were in store at? This will help the management team find your specific failed transactions. Can you also provide us the contact number you used to call our careline? What time was this call made at? We can get this call listened to. Grant

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  I ve been a Sainsbury s shopper for a long  long time now and frankly  I far prefer the supermarket to certain others  that will remain nameless but that rhyme with  fresco  and  Mazda . However  I feel rather as though the Sainsbury s empire has let the thousands upon thousands of coeliacs in the UK down this week.   From 9th - 15th May this year  it is Coeliac Awareness Week. It is an incurable autoimmune condition that affects an estimated 1 in 100 people in the UK. For one week every year  the major supermarkets typically reduce the cost of gluten free items (which  as you know  are already up to five times the price of their non-gluten free counterparts)  giving coeliacs and others who avoid gluten  a chance to stock up on items for a slightly lower price.   However  I notice that this year  while Tesco offers 3-for-2 on their entire free from range  Asda has  rolled back  the price of gluten free times and Morrisons has created a range of offers across their gluten free items  Sainsbury s has declined to participate. It feels a little like a slap in the face for your coeliac customers  who have enthusiastically purchased from your generally wide range of gluten free items. Instead of feeling looked after and having our custom appreciated  we are left feeling that our custom is better appreciated by competing supermarkets.   This evening  I will be going to my local Tesco  where I will be stocking up on various gluten free items. Items I would have preferred to buy from my preferred supermarket. I can only hope that you will make the effort next year.   Disappointedly    Vikki Cook
column9: I can. It's Talbot Heath/Alder Hill in Poole.

column4: Hi my husband came into your redditch store on Sunday with 3 of our children to get shopping in because I have been very unwell. After walking around the store for an hour or so  hubby was finished so went to checkout. He loaded it all up  the lady put it through and then the machines stopped working. She tried to put it through twice but decided it had failed and asked him to leave as they were closing. It was 4pm. Apparently the cash machines were out of order too. So he left with no shopping at 4pm on Sunday   he drove around for some time and found a tesco express shop open. He got a few items but because of my health barely anything as I need wholefoods and organic. We realised that the payment had infact gone through today and popped back in expecting an apology and a refund. Instead served by the same lady again  she sent him away with no refund or way of apology. She told him that it s his problem now.  The bank will apparently be able to refund him. I am sat outside the bank now  have been for twenty minutes already. We love sainsburys choice and range but have been left really upset by the treatment within the store  no word of apology for hours of wasted time and money that we simply did not have spare.  I am really disappointed 😞
column9: Hi, can you PM me a contact number and a preferred time for a phone call to discuss this with you? Brad

column4: I ordered an online grocery shop with you without bags to be all environmentally friendly. The result was 6 pints of milk all over a third of my shopping  my kitchen floor and your poor driver. Please speak to your packers and get them to find a better way of transporting things like milk cartons - I ve just had to steam clean the floor and wash off the sealed items that could be saved. Oh... and also tell them with the best will in the world I can t manage to eat two loaves of bread by midnight tonight!!!!
column9: I have done. It's your driver I feel for having to smell of stale milk all day!

column4: I was in your penrith store yesterday at three. I have been using the penrith store since February as the carlisle was flooded but due to my multiple chemical sensitivity giving carlisle time to do what they need to. Well yesterday I asked if someone can check if they had andrex white rolls in the back as unable to get them off the shelf. The young lady went and checked came back with the toilet rolls I need said thank so much. I was still doing some shopping and the same lady came back to chat to me about my chemical sensitivity as she had never herd of it. I explained  what it is. But really wanted to say thank you she really made me feel understoodunderstood never got that from the carlisle store i am not saying that they are not great but the lady yesterday talked to me. Thank you
column9: Sorry don't have a name, she had brown hair in a ponytail, 5.5 and she told me she has a little boy who has eczema. Sorry I can't help with her name

column4: What a disappointment - I made a bulk order for a special function and took all the right steps but for some reason communication fell through on Sainsbury s side between head office and the store and I only got a quarter of what I ordered. I have spent a half hour on the phone (most of which on hold) and all they said can do for me is fill the order NEXT WEEK. Not acceptable. I need it today  which is why I ordered it so that it would be delivered today. I have also been promised a phone call which has not yet come. I will not be shopping with you all anymore. A complete disappointment on all points  you guys should not commit to bulk orders if you can t fill them. Shame on you Sainsbury s on how this was handled  no accountability and no concern shown thus far. If it was my business  I would get on the phone  get to the right people to fix it  not put it back on the customer and say  it s just one of those things...
column9: Sorry Laura, can you PM your order number & account holder's name please? Steven

column4: Last night there was an advert on TV for the latest  Doom  game  promoting Sainsbury s as the retailer where it would be available.  Very graphical  the advert was clearly not suitable for younger children  and it had an 18 stamp on it.  Yet it was shown at just after 7.30pm  when younger children would still be awake and watching.  I am shocked that as a major retailer  you do not check these sorts of things.  You should care about your customers  and the implications that this sort of poor advert scheduling has on the family unit.
column9: It was also a waste of time because it will be a rubbish game with a poor multiplayer experience. 😹😹

column9: Hi there, I'm sorry about this. Can you try using another browser at all? Maryclare

column4: Having seen a great news clip about Morrisons and their customer services with a young autistic girl  my recent experience with Sainsburys should leave you ashamed.  I was at your Lytham store on Sunday with my 2 young boys (with additional needs)  a rude customer pushed in front of me at the checkout and your staff ignored it. When i was eventually served I pointed out that they should ask customers to use the queue like everyone else and your staff were extremely rude  he raised his voice at me  talked about my children and told me to shut up. Needless to say I have written a letter of complaint but I have no expectation of receiving a reply. I shall not be shopping with you again. Appalling.
column9: Hi Danny, thanks for your reply, I have PM'd you the letter I have sent it via your website.

In order for us to get this fed back appropriately, I'd appreciate if you could PM across some further information about your experience, such as when this happened and the name or description of the colleague in question please? Thanks, Danny.

column4: I went into the Talbot heath store last Saturday for a quick lunch. I ordered sausage and mash for myself and my toddler. When it came the  sausage  in the children s meal was clearly of very inferior quality and when I tasted it (luckily my son chose to spit it out) was frankly disgusting. I wouldn t feed something like that to my dog. I was told that children s meals come ready made while adult meals are made on the premises.  The ingredients list for the children s sausage showed they contain only 18% meat. This is legally not a sausage which must be 42% meat. I will be contacting trading standards about this. I am horrified that sainsburys consider children unworthy of the same standard of food as adults  and that they would serve something which is clearly not as described.  Fair warning to sainsburys customers.... Don t feed your children from the  children s menu  unless you want them to eat slops!
column9: Where do I send it to? I'm not sure why you need it, as my complaint is about the quality of the children's meal in general, not just the one I had.

column4: I went into the Talbot heath store last Saturday for a quick lunch. I ordered sausage and mash for myself and my toddler. When it came the  sausage  in the children s meal was clearly of very inferior quality and when I tasted it (luckily my son chose to spit it out) was frankly disgusting. I wouldn t feed something like that to my dog. I was told that children s meals come ready made while adult meals are made on the premises.  The ingredients list for the children s sausage showed they contain only 18% meat. This is legally not a sausage which must be 42% meat. I will be contacting trading standards about this. I am horrified that sainsburys consider children unworthy of the same standard of food as adults  and that they would serve something which is clearly not as described.  Fair warning to sainsburys customers.... Don t feed your children from the  children s menu  unless you want them to eat slops!
column9: Was it British meat?

column4: I had great service in the Mere Green Sainsbury s the other day! So wanted to shout about it.  I popped in to Sainsbury s to buy some essentials and left my 4 week old baby in the car with my mum. Just coming to the end of my shop and my mum rings me to tell me my son is crying and appears quite distressed and wants feeding. I m the only person that can feed him as I m breastfeeding. I therefore asked the manager on duty if I could leave my trolley for about 10 mins whilst I pop out to feed my son. She not only said yes to that but offered to put everything through the till for me and pack it all away in my bags so all I had to do was come back into store and pay at customer services and my shopping was all there neatly packed away in my bags ready for me to collect. I was so impressed with this! I have always been a Sainsbury s fan but even more so now! So kind and a massive thank you to the manager. I didn t catch her name sadly.
column9: Hi Alice, that's fantastic to hear! I'd love to get this fed back to the store manager for you. In order for me to do so, can you PM a bit more info please, such as when you were in the store and a brief description of the colleague in question? Thanks, Danny.

column4: Can sainsburys please explain why they think it s fair to advertise on the delivery booking page £1 £2 etc delivery slots only to find out it s actually £7!!! I never spend more than £20-30 a week on my full family shop so I thought it was great that you do a minimum £25 online shop but I was so wrong to think that was great as I refuse to pay over that just for that delivery charge!! You won t be seeing my custom online!! I don t drive so have to rely on lifts or taxis so doing online shopping is more convenient for me but certainly not better on my pocket!! I m a tight budget so scrimp on my shopping I don t see why you have the right to charge those of us with tight budgets higher delivery than everyone else just because we can t spend £40 or more on our shopping. All of the supermarkets are the same on this and it s so unfair!!!!
column9: Really sorry you're unhappy Natasha. I'll log your concerns for consideration in the future. This means we can also monitor any further feedback we receive for this. Liz

column4: I recently bought a room fragrance in the form of a reed diffuser. It was one of the best ones I have ever bought. The house smelled divine. I decided that for a treat I would buy myself another one. I looked on the bottle that came with it to see the fragrance  but there wasn t anything on it to identify the smell. Everything needed to identify it was in the packaging that went in the bin some time ago! This is just a suggestion  maybe you could put a little sticker on the bottom of the bottles  so that if people like me want to buy another one  we can see what the fragrance was called. Thanks.

column4: Just visited Sainsbury s Local in Mansell Street near Aldgate and one assistant got in my way. While I apologised and he apologised too he also touched me on my shoulder  which I didn t like because I have autism and I found it unprofessional of him to do that. I was also anxious in case he would  terrorise me. I told him I didn t like it but after I told him this another assistant asked me if I was okay. I explained to her what had happened but I couldn t understand what she said after that. If staff received more adequate training to deal with those on the autistic spectrum then I would have a happier shopping experience.
column9: Just sent the PM.

column4: This afternoon I tried to shop at Sainsbury s Alphington Road  Exeter. First attempt with Visa debit card was declined. Embarrassing but I checked my banking app and there was more than enough money available so I asked the cashier to try again. She did and again it was declined. Except this time I was looking at my banking app and watched the exact amount leave my account. After some calculations I realised that both times the card was declined the money left my account. I left Sainsbury s £120 poorer and with no shopping. The manager I talked to accused me of trying to pull a fast one even though in the time I was talking to him staff informed him of at least 3 other issues with their banking system. He assured money they hadn t taken any money but having got home and checked my bank account I am still missing EXACTLY the amount Sainsbury s say was declined.  So sainsbury s what should I do now?
column9: Having spoken online to one of your customer services reps it appears I am not the only customer this has happened to today but that Sainsbury's are in no hurry to return the money. Could be overnight, could be a few days, depends on the bank......not exactly helpful!

Except this time I was looking at my banking app and watched the exact amount leave my account. After some calculations I realised that both times the card was declined the money left my account. I left Sainsbury s £120 poorer and with no shopping. The manager I talked to accused me of trying to pull a fast one even though in the time I was talking to him staff informed him of at least 3 other issues with their banking system. He assured money they hadn t taken any money but having got home and checked my bank account I am still missing EXACTLY the amount Sainsbury s say was declined.  So sainsbury s what should I do now?
column9: Ok that was salisbury store around 3.45pm

column4: Yet another power cut at Brookwood Sainsbury! This time power comes back on and am told to keep shopping although their might be a small delay whilst systems come back on line. So off I go ........and power goes out for a second time! Queue for self service tills which are only ones working on advice of staff. Despite one customer having logical idea of asking if staff could maybe help to scan or pack at self service this is ignored! Massive queue.....nearly at front.....self service tills go down! Staff just standing around with no instructions. Told to leave all shopping  and the store. Go to car. Car park chaos as everyone now leaving at once......no staff in sight! Seriously  strategically you would think that putting a back up generator on self service tills would be logical to avoid so much food sitting around in shop. Had to to to Sainsbury local as no time to get to a different supermarket......so basically had to shop  queue again and pay more money than I would have done originally for the privilege! And to add to it  because Sainsbury had no hayfever tablets left yesterday  had to abandon ones picked up today and none in local I face misery overnight. Poor show Sainsbury. Poor strategic and emergency planning/support and customer service.
column9: Apologies about that Nicola, can you confirm what day & time this happened? Debs

column4: What a joke! Shop opens at 10 but can t pay until 10.30. Your only open for browsing? So everyone is stood around waiting to pay  also loads of people just leaving their groceries and going elsewhere. Why?
column9: Hi Dawn, thanks for getting in touch! Due to the Sunday Trading Act, in England and Wales, we are limited in the hours that we can operate and we open 30 minutes early to allow customers time to browse before completing their shop when we open our tills for business. Which store did you visit? Ryan.

column4: Hi  I just wanted to say how disappointed I am at the lack of customer service in our local sainsbury in shenley church end. When it opened my husband spoke to the store manager about putting up posters advertising our charity events  the store manager said not a problem and to just pop them on the board which we ve been doing for nearly a year now. The other day when he was doing it my husband was made to feel like a criminal by the store security and customer services and then to add insult to injury I go in a few days later and they have taken his poster down. When asked why they said they can t advertise it - despite the board being covered in other local charity events!  All the other sainsburies  tesco  morrisons and Costa support us but not our local store! So I certainly shan t bother to support them by shopping their- I will walk to morrisons or tesco instead!!!
column9: Hi Kirsty, we didn't speak to the manager, I just spoke to a staff member who said if it was taken down then they couldn't advertise it! There was also no apology from customer service or the security guard who both made my husband feel unwelcome!

column4: I visited you store at 24 bridgenorth rd  compton on friday morning. As i was queing up to pay i noticed a shopping basket full of ripe browning bananas. I asked the assistant on the till if they are reduced and she said that they were not for sale and need to be thrown away. I was totaly shocked they were just a little brown  the colour bananas go when they are ripe. I asked if i could purchase some as would have been perfect for cooking and lovely and sweet to eat. Again she was adamant that they were not allowed to be sold as they were no good.  I was totally shocked that they were going to go straight into the bin. As i was leaving the assistant said to another girl working were going have to move them which had given me the impression i hadnt been the first person to ask about them. Which means therr coyld have bern some happy customers and sales through the till. I know stores like asda bag them up and sell them for 10-20p a bag. As your company is so commited at getting thier customers to reduce thier own food waste i would have though you would have been commited too. There are even plenty of charities or homeless shelters im sure theses could have helped or neen used to create something else. Im really disappointed and will think twice before shopping there again.
column9: Hi there Jayde, you can read more about our approach to waste here: http://bit.ly/1Ba8lEP. Can you just confirm which store you're referring to here please? http://bit.ly/21oWP3I. Debs

column4: I must spend at least £100 a week in your Pocklington store even though it s expensive and limited for stock...Never again. I bought two pizzas from you mid week. Came to cook them tonight and one had mould on it and the pepperoni was off. Still within the sell by date. Took them back to the store who told me unless you have your receipt we can t change them. Of course i didnt have a receipt for a God damned pizza ...if id changed my mind and wanted ham and pineapple I could understand but it was mouldy. I think it s a disgrace. I won t set foot in your store again.
column9: So sorry about this Gill. Can you DM us a pic of the barcode from the pizza? We'll see what we can do for you from here. Also, if you could give us a time you were in store and a name/description of the colleague who you dealt with, we'll make sure this is looked into as this is not up to our usual high standards. Ryan.

column4: Very sad to see you have erected an LA style glass barrier between the staff and customers in your Helston store.  Helston is hardly bandit country and there has never been any kind of violent episode in all the time the store has been open...in fact never been one in any of the stores here.  It s a small cornish town we know each other it s really ugly and unnecessary even the post office does not have such over the top devices... So shame on you sainsburys I am off to tesco where the staff are not separated by a glass partition and we can say hello not good god what the hell were they thinking!

column4: Well another shop that s been delivered from Sainsburys that has cooked meat and raw meat in the same bag! When I spoke to the manager of the store apparently he wasn t sure if there is an actual rule to say that they can t be together!!   Slightly concerning if even the managers don t know that food safety rule 😤
column9: Hi Clare, which items do you mean? Presealed cooked and uncooked meat is safe to keep within the same bags, and we will provide seperate bags for over-the-counter meats which are not presealed before purchase free of charge - so that you can store them inside the same bag other products without risk of cross-contamination. Ryan.

column4: Just wanted to say how impressed I have been today. I usually have home delivery from the Bagshot Road store but decided today to do click and collect at Winnersh.  I hadn t realised that a driver from Calcot would be bringing my shopping to winnersh. My delivery was booked for 3.30 - 4.30. At 2.45 I received a call to say unfortunately my delivery van was stuck in traffic following an awful accident on the M4. I then received 2 further phone calls keeping me updated and still received my delivery within the timeslot at 4.20pm.  As always great customer service.
column9: Excellent, glad they kept you updated! Sorry for the delay. Stephen.

column4: Sainsbury s I would just like to congratulate you on your SHAMBOLIC click and collect service!  I utilised the service for the first time today and really wish I had not  I regularly use Tesco  Asda and Morrisions with no issues.  I have complained to your  customer services  department (0800 328 1700)  however the service I have received from them is as shocking as your click and collect!  Whilst I appreciate substitutions cannot be helped  it is normal practice with your competitors for them to be made on a like for like  quantity for quantity basis  clearly not with yourselves  I had ordered 2 packs of 900g steak  totalling 1.8kg  this was substituted for a pack of 368g steak!!  I rang to complain the first time cut off whilst speaking to an agent with no call back and then the second time promised a callback but none received!  Once again SHAMBOLIC!
column9: Just sent the details over

I have complained to your  customer services  department (0800 328 1700)  however the service I have received from them is as shocking as your click and collect!  Whilst I appreciate substitutions cannot be helped  it is normal practice with your competitors for them to be made on a like for like  quantity for quantity basis  clearly not with yourselves  I had ordered 2 packs of 900g steak  totalling 1.8kg  this was substituted for a pack of 368g steak!!  I rang to complain the first time cut off whilst speaking to an agent with no call back and then the second time promised a callback but none received!  Once again SHAMBOLIC!
column9: Whilst I appreciate that!  It does not explain the fact that a substituion was made for a lesser quantity!

column4: Hi to any managers- regional or otherwise.  I was shopping in Sainsbury s Lincoln store today with a very tired / ill  3 yr old.  My husband and I had started shopping. Half a trolley full   we get a call from one of my sons  school. He s not well can we pick him up. 😕  Well  you can imagine the scene. We re about 8 miles from the school  half a trolley of shopping and a screaming  (literally ) 3 yr old. She hadn t stopped since we walked in  wouldn t calm down for anything. We were going past the fresh fruit aisle  struggling with the still screaming 3 yr old & discussing what we would do..... (and still  she s screaming 😔) A member of staff came up to us   said:  excuse me  is she OK?    Me:   yes  just can t stop her crying  Staff:   Would she like a piece of fruit  banana  whilst you re walking around and getting sorted?  Me:  Oh  yes please  thank you   And honestly  she ate that banana and didn t cry again in store. As silly as it may sound  that one act of random kindness from your staff member helped us no end! We were able to pay for the shopping we already had and get out to pick up my son with no more issues. As we were leaving the store we saw him again  he came and asked if she was any better and wished us well with our son. My point with this  is that one small act  of taking a minute to ask if we were okay changed the next few hours for the better. His name is Neville and I d like to thank him for doing that. It s not done as much as it should be in this day and age. So Thank you Neville  your one act of random kindness helped.
column9: Yes, thank you. My little girl (3yr old) had a sleep and was fine. And my son came home and went to bed. Both much better this morning. And Thank you. It was more the fact that he'd seen we were struggling and stopped what he was doing to help. Nowadays people are too busy with their heads down to notice, Thanks again, Sarah.

column4: NOT HAPPYwith Sainsbury s today! Loin Pork joint  £4.50@kg. I needed 1kg minimum so selected 1 kg pack. All the packs that weighd less than 1kg clearly stated the price per kilo AND the price of the pack. None of the 1kg packs stated the price per kilo. No price for the pack either. Got to the till and the pack came up as £5.50. I queried it. A member of staff went to check and came back with the answer: £4.50 a kilo for small joints of less than a kilo but £5.50 for the medium 1 kilo joints. But it s NOT stated on the packet! As all my shopping was already unloaded onto the belt at the check out and there were customers waiting to be served after me I decided not to go back and choose an alternative joint but paid the £5.50 rather than swap it for the cheaper smaller joint I was offered at the checkout. I should have gone to the customer service desk to complaint but rushed home instead. However  it has occurred to me that  if all the Sainsbury s in Dorset or even nationally are doing the same and lots of customers are tricked into paying £5.50 instead of £4.50 unknowingly for their purchase  that amounts to an awful of extra profit. Was that done on purpose or is it a genuine mistake? Looking forward to an answer from Sainsbury s.
column9: < 0012 4485 >. Hope this helps you sort this. Thank you.

column9: That explains why schwartz are pushing sales in sainsburys by offfering cash refunds for purchases then

column4: Hi there  Why can t I buy your own brand Spices and curry powder online now?
column9: Hi Lucy, on the 12th June we'll be implementing a review within our herbs & spice range. This is an extensive review. Some of the changes include removing many Schwartz products from sale and introducing a much wider selection of our own brand products in redesigned packaging and new shelves in store. We'll also be reviewing our range of speciality ingredients. As a result of this, we'll be withdrawing some products from sale in the lead up to the official launch date on the 12th June. Some withdrawn products will be discontinued and others will be relaunched when the review goes live. Hope this helps, Danny.

column4: The Manager John in Sainsbury s Store in Charlton gave my dad a £2 gift card because my dad complained about that store having gone off mince meat which my dad went out of his way twice down that store to get the problem sorted out. I Think that was absolutely outrageous we could of ended up having food poisoning and all he could afford to give was a poxy £2 gift card! yet we spent £4 for the gone off mince meat!. I just want to say that I am appalled at how that store deals with problems like these and the goodwill gesture they offer is disgusting  it doesn t even amount to what we spent paying for the mince meat.
column9: Hi Becky, sorry for the upset! Did your dad refuse the gift card when my colleague offered it? Chris.

I just want to say that I am appalled at how that store deals with problems like these and the goodwill gesture they offer is disgusting  it doesn t even amount to what we spent paying for the mince meat.
column9: If you're really in it for the vouchers/compo, sometimes it's worth taking a gamble and eating the dodgy food.  ""I/we got ill"", will always pay more than ""We could have become ill"" (so long as you get something from the doctor to prove it).

column4: So 3 weeks after my mum bought a gift card from sainsburys Liverpool Prescot road store  which had already been spent when my auntie took it in to redeem they have finally admitted there was a fraud going on with the card and their awful customer service did not even offer an apology after accusing my elderly mum and aunt of theft when they got caught in the cross fire of this  they merely Just told her she could now spend the card !! Not likely  she got her money back and we will not spend money in that store ever again! The store manager seriously needs to address his lack of customer service skills 😡
column9: Hi grant it was the manager in store on the 23 April , he threatened my elderly mother with security when she tried to get her point across, he previously to this made my auntie feel very bad when insinuating she had already spent the card, a long list of bad customer service in relation to this matter, disappointed doesn't begin to describe how we feel

column9: Hi grant my aunt tried to spend it on the Friday and was told it had been spent, my mum went in on the Friday night and the manager promised to do what he could to resolve it, on the Saturday a different manager seen my mum and told her it was nothing to do with sainsburys and to deal with it herself !! She tried to explain the matter to him thinking he had misunderstood and he threatened to have security remove her from the store ! She is 71 years old and was very shook up by this experience ! She had been a loyal customer since it was built !  We took the matter to the police and also to card services, no one bothered calling her back from sainsburys card services it was left up to us to do all the chasing up ! One conversation I had with Bev a duty manager in the store last week confirmed that the cards had been withdrawn from sale due to fraud ! Why wasn't my mum contacted and an apology made ? It wasn't even about the money in the end it was about the awful treatment she received following this

column4: Could you pass on my thanks to Mark the delivery driver and the team (I think they come from Nantwich). He arrived very late after doing battle with the traffic caused by problems on the M6. He rang me to warn me he was stuck and to check I was still ok for delivery  and still managed to be cheery even after an hour and half in traffic. I think I would have given up if it was me! Problems (or the M6) happen  it s how you deal with it that matters  and he dealt with it brilliantly.

column4: Huge thank you to Louise at your store in Prestwick!! Did my first grocery shop today on my own with my 6 week old baby. She decided right at the end of the shop that she couldn t wait a second longer for her feed and was screaming the place down so Louise offered to put the shop through the till and she packed it for me while I fed Ella and then I could pay at customer services when I was done. It really took the pressure off a new mum who got caught out with a starving baby. Fantastic customer service!

This morning I saw a elderly lady fall to her face  lots of sainsburys staff came to her and my help (watch) but none first aid trained  it took a good 8 mins for someone trained to come to help and take over her care from me...maybe pop a few more staff on a first aid course? It doesn t cost much  luckily the lady was ok about from a cut face but it could of been worse. #justsaying
column9: Hi there Kelly, I'm sorry to hear this. I hope the lady is okay. Can you let us know which store this happened at? Debs

column9: North cheam, lady went off in an ambulance, and what I saw she wasn't to bad, but just think there was a lot of staff hanging around not knowing what to do. Once a first aider came approx 8/9 minutes after the incident there didn't even have a first aid box. First aid is such a vital life skill, maybe get more of your lovely staff on the course.

column4: I regularly buy your organic milk - where can I find out what checks you put in place with regards to the animal welfare and whether you buy from the new american style dairy factories?
column9: You can't comment as to the animal welfare?

column4: I regularly buy your organic milk - where can I find out what checks you put in place with regards to the animal welfare and whether you buy from the new american style dairy factories?
column9: Milk (and other dairy products) has a dairy source identifier code on it so you can easily determine where it has come from yourself (supplier).

column4: I regularly buy your organic milk - where can I find out what checks you put in place with regards to the animal welfare and whether you buy from the new american style dairy factories?
column9: Hi there, unfortunately, we cant give out this type of information, however, I can advise that we only source milk from British farmers. Thanks, Megan.

column9: Ps - Local Authorities provide subsidies to Bus companies to operate routes.  Given the unprecedented cuts to Local Authority budgets by the Government, it's understandable that unpopular routes might have to be cut to balance the books.  Re school transport, there are legal obligations upon your Local Authority to provide school buses where pupils have to travel a certain distance within a catchment area.  Anything in excess of this obligation is a matter for parents to take up with their Local Authority who will assess it on a case by case basis.

column4: Please can you tell me the nutritional content of the hotpot in your cafe? I have searched the website and everything is on it apart from the hotpot! Thank you
column9: Hi Leanne, I've spoken with a member of our café team and I've been advised the following - per serving, the hotpot contains 1378kJ (328kcal) Energy, 8.3g Fat (of which saturates 2.7g), 3.8g Mono-unsaturates, 1.1g Polyunsaturates, 47.2g Carbohydrate (of which sugars 12.7g), 29.5g Starch, 9.9g Fibre, 14.8g Protein and 1.09g of Salt. I hope this answers your question! Ryan.

column4: hi there I was in your store last night and I suffer from epilepsy. I collapsed and by the time I came round there was 3 members of staff round me including a first aider. they got me a pillow for under my head and got me water. when I was able.to stand they didn t make me wait in line to be served. they opened up a till just to get me through quicker incase it happened again. so I would like to say thank you to everyone that helped me. I think if not for them it might have been worse. they all have my respect and gratitude.
column9: Hi Chris, that's great to hear. I hope you're feeling better today! Can you send me a picture of the bottom of your receipt? I'll make sure to pass your thanks along to the folks in-store. Ryan.

column4: Sainsburys  I just need to first of all apologise and also thank you at the same time. Me and my partner always shop at Sainsburys and have constantly been told to try Morrisons as it is  so much cheaper . So today we decided to give that statement a chance and we went to our local Morrisons. I can quite honestly say it was the biggest mistake we have made this bank holiday - almost every item that we normally buy was at least 40-60p more expensive and we ended up having to get a budget shop in Morrisons for the same amount that we would get a  treat ourselves  shop from Sainsburys. (Also like to add that the 3 for 10 offer on meat in Morrisons is worth half the value you get from meat in Sainsburys... Just saying!) So I d like to apologise for not keeping to our roots and believing other hype.... And I would like to thank you for first of all keeping your prices low and secondly for awarding us with some lovely vouchers when we went into your Ripley store straight after  because we forgot butter 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻😀
column9: No problem Mike, glad to have you back! Neil.

I am sick of coming to your store and seeing lazy people with no children in the baby paring with no children but you are quick to hand out parking fines for those that park in disabled spots.
column9: I got a ticket in Sainsbury's Wandsworth once. The parent and child spaces were full of people with no kids and the disabled were all free (more than 10). I nipped in quickly (also paid for the parking by the way), left my mum and baby in the car and still got a ticket, it was the rudest warden ever. I appealed and they accepted it in the end, but it was very unfair as at the time I told them about people using the parent and child ones and they didn't bat an eyelid.

column4: I ve just been into your large Worcester St John s store and when I approached the only checkout with someone there I was told she wasn t open and I had to use the self service ones. Now I m more than capable of doing this but sometimes I don t want the hassle of  unexpected item in bagging area  and just want a human to serve me. It s hardly very good customer service to not have a single checkout open in a store that size! What about all the old people I saw in there that aren t as confident with technology? Absolutely ridiculous  I m surprised the staff aren t clued up to the fact that the more people they can t be bothered to serve & send to do it themselves the less likelihood they ll have of a job in the future... Please sort it out Sainsbury s and have at least one checkout open  if not for me then for all the older shoppers that want a bit of chat while they pay!
column9: I haven't come across this issue at such a large store, only the smaller ones

column4: I went to your Store in Ruislip yesterday(1st May 2016)  for my usual shop. I would like to say a massive thank you to Trudy at your South Ruislip Store on Long Drive Ruislip. I could see she was busy on the bakery section when I asked if they had the Mascarpone Truffle Cake in stock which  I wanted for my daughters birthday   which is displayed on the fresh cream cake display.  She said the last time she checked it was out of stock however she went to double check again to see if it had come during the night delivery. Yes it did and I was so happy as this saved me a trip to the cake shop. Trudy was busy and I believe she deserves to be recognised. Many of your competitors that I have been to always find the easy way out by saying  they don t have it in-stock  however Trudy went out of her way and I really appreciate that. I was served by Adam on the checkout who was friendly. It was quite funny as there was a fishy smell which we tried to work out where it was coming from. All your staff at this store are helpful  bubbly and very friendly. If you ask where something is they will offer to take you there even though they are busy. Fantastic and keep up the excellent customer service.
column9: That's great feedback Anita! I've passed it on to the store, so the colleagues can be recognised for it. Thanks for taking the time to share it with us. Faiza.

column4: Just wanted to give a big thank you to Alistair at the bakery in your meadowbank store. column4: I returned some items of clothing I had had for my birthday to the Leek Store as they did not quite suit me. When I questioned this I was told there had been a clothing sale with 25% off aall items and that was the reason why. I asked when thtis was as I shop there frequently and had not been aware of this. I don t think I will be shopping at Sainsbury s again.

column4: I would like to say a big thank you to one of your staff from the Ripon store. My daughter is tube fed and today I had to pop into your store she wasn t well and while in your store was taken poorly.  While most people walked past and one lady asked why didn t I take her outside. One of your workers went and got me tissues to help me. He was busy himself yet took the time to see i needed some assistants. column4: So go to the closet store to bring back slippers that my partner picked up thinking was our daughters size  hanger says size 8  slippers are size 7! Which we paid more and are worthless  have to now travel back the 40min journey to find the receipt which wasn t in my bag when I got to the till. Ridicous when it s your mistake for using the wrong hanger misleading us to buying the size we didn t want and cannot change unless we pay more money....not a great shopping experience

column4: What a joke - just used Sainsbury s Click and Collect as we had been given an £18 off when you spend £60 voucher to use this service.  I placed the order to be collected at the Redditch store at 10.30am this morning.  We arrived just after 10.30am to find that the Click and Collect station is just a couple of car park spaces at the back of the car park - no shelter from the elements - next to a space for a van.  As the van was no where to be seen and there were others waiting my husband went into the store to be told that the order was coming from Longbridge!  Were we wrong to think that they would pick the items from the large store in whose car park we were waiting?  The van arrived about 10 minutes later and the driver was apologetic as he d had to fill in at last minute  fine  this happens.   What about your environmental footprint Sainsbury?    What about your customer experience - if it had been lashing down with rain  everything - shopping  driver and customer would have been soaked?    Unbelievably you didn t have a 4pt skimmed milk and had to supply 2 x 2pts and my 18 pack of toilet paper just didn t turn up!    Observations are that if you are trying to get more people to use this service-and I m sure you are otherwise why give vouchers with such an attractive discount-think about how this service is provided.  If you re not picking at the large store where it s collected then don t offer the service there. It s supposed to save time for the customer!!  It s cost me more in time as I had to then go and purchase toilet paper from the store  and frustration levels are high.  NEVER AGAIN!!!
column9: Can you send me you email address please as I don't seem to be able to private message you.   The order no is 35049158

column9: Thanks for contacting Sainsbury's. This is an automated response to let you know we've received your email.  We appreciate the time you've taken to get in touch, and one of our colleagues will reply in person as soon as possible.  For answers to frequently asked questions, why not visit our Help Centre at help.sainsburys.co.uk.  You can live well for less than you thought at Sainsbury's based on price perception data.  This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential and intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify the system manager (postmaster@sainsburys.co.uk) and delete it from your system.  J Sainsbury plc (185647 England) Sainsbury's Supermarkets Ltd (3261722 England) Registered Offices: 33 Holborn, London, EC1N 2HT  Received 1 May at 14.17 from customer services.
